gvhB4PGtyOw_GIKof9sb-g.text: We started the evening of March 2nd at Franco's.  Our waiter wasn't very friendly to begin with, but then the restaurant lost electricity.  After being told that the kitchen could still function, but never being told that it would actually take orders, we left after 20 minutes of being ignored and headed to Tomaso's.  That was the best decision of the evening.  The service at Tomaso's was excellent.  The wine and food were absolutely delicious.

QZkvt95KQ1N95Ww7_sPHog.text: I had dinner at Tomaso's the other night, and found it to be a very solid meal. I was able to secure a table without a reservation, though that may be always possible, especially on the weekends.  The wine list is extensive and impressive, including a nice selection of wines by the glass. Unfortunately they do not stock any of the great craft beers coming out of Italy. I started with a Tuscan bean soup that was good, though lacking in anything exciting. For my main, I had a daily special that was a house made swiss chard and kale ravioli stuffed with ricotta cheese, with a balsamic demi-glaze.  Service was attentive, but not smothering. Overall very good dinner.

XBZIrzYsF6Ts8ly5Qm6E3g.text: Had dinner five fish dinner on black and red pasta outrageously good. Service was excellent food was great   House chianti was great.

bGlVuvbdNsRt0xsybKhi9A.text: Had heard good things about Tomaso's and finally hosted dinner there for out-of-town business clients. Was very impressed when I walked in. The decor was quietly distinguished and gave a warm upscale impression.  Two of us each ordered the Osso Bucco that had been removed from the bone. It was very blah and the pasta it was on was overdone and stuck together like one big clump of dough. How does an Italian restaurant not know how to make good al dente pasta?  Definitely won't be back.

xkZge4W00BDOocFZg67eXg.text: Food was excellent. The chef gave a personal tutorial class to my wife and her friends on my wife's birthday. They made her birthday party extra special. The service was phenomenal and everyone at the restaurant went the extra mile to make the food and the service unforgettable!

PfRPyTJkkmbKEhD8uLzNXA.text: I must give a shout out to this lovely restaurant. I was in Phoenix visiting a friend in the hospital and eating on my own. The hotel food was dismal, didn't want fast food, and everything else was Mexican, burger, or chain.I was craving pasta. Drove a little away from the busy section and saw Tomaso's. I thought it was a mid-range pizza place but was tired of driving around an unfamiliar city in the dark. So I walk in wearing jeans and a T-shirt (after hanging around a hospital for many hours) looking the worse for the wear. A lone oldish woman. It turns out to be a white tablecloth place with a very nicely dressed staff. A waiter greeted me and led me without hesitation to a nice table. Treated me like a valued guest and service was excellent. I had great pasta with prawns and broccolini in a light tomato based broth. Excellent rustic bread, herb butter and a perfect Chianti. I'm so grateful to have found such a respite after a long day. Thank you, Tomaso's. Highly recommend. Glad CPK had no parking!!!!

5Nk3-_IJUsqfQXi7Yn3GCA.text: This place doesn't live up to its reputation. Food was so so at best. Service was ok but I didn't need the waiters life story. I've heard about it for years , looked forward to going and can't see myself going back.

t_6GMtVDcAighvjfbPxcug.text: Waited two hours for our meal...no literally two hours. After an hour and 15 minutes, they decided to so generously comp us two drinks, which is exactly what a person needs after starving for two hours, more alcohol. The waiter was very nice and polite and not his fault. After two hours of waiting, we decided to walk out and he chased us out saying he has our food in hand. The restaurant management was aware of the situation and offered me a "glass of wine on the house"...I don't even drink wine and the whole situation was totally absurd. I've been to restaurants where the simplest mistake was made and I got comped an appetizer, drinks AND dessert. These guys did NOTHING right and comped us drinks which we didn't even consume bc we were starving. I will never go here again.

LgA7eF0XVrITXltiMB1GBg.text: Great place to eat! My wife visits a shop just south of them and gets holes drilled in her head there, so we always go to eat at my fav Italian joint after her sessions!

IcmdD4q_wuR_87whyj8M5w.text: As good as it gets; superb food, atmosphere, service. Try it during Restaurant Week when you can sample favorites

UkOT8bnKEh_V_gStI91RQg.text: SUCH a disappointing night. This was a dinner we had long awaited, my grandfather and father flew in from Chicago to celebrate turning 90 and 60, as well as I turned 30. My youngest sister also flew in as a surprise. The dinner started fine and service steadily declined. At one point we didn't see our waiter in over 20 minutes and our food took an hour to come out. These two factors combined really killed the mood at our table, as my grandfather was upset which in turn upset my dad. Additionally, the atmosphere definitely lacks compared to other restaurants of the same price caliber. In all, for the price, mediocre food, and terrible service, I would not return. There are so many other restaurants with fabulous food and service that would have made our celebrations what they should have been.

ZZUj5n7sziS3X9cSvbWGEw.text: Eight of us dined at Tomaso's on a Sunday evening in March. Our table was understandably a large one, but soon after we were seated a few other large parties arrived as well.  Our waiter was pleasant but unattentive. He frequently forgot to collect everyone's orders as he went around the table. On more than one occasion, he placed drinks or dishes in front of the wrong person - something you expect at Denny's but not at a restaurant of this caliber. We had to search for him frequently to refill water or iced tea glasses. He failed to deliver promised second glasses of wine to two in our party, but somehow did remember to put them on the bill.  Before the meal started, we had asked for the bill to be split in half, and he gladly agreed. But he delivered a single bill. When we reminded him that we requested two bills, gave us a sour face and took a long time to bring split checks. However, the way he split the checks was incorrect and quite frankly (despite several college degrees at the table) unintelligible.   When we FINALLY got him to come by and explained that the split was done incorrectly, he blamed us, made it seem like we were being unreasonable, and then brought back the check split differently - but still incorrectly.   In the end, although the food was good, we left with a bitter taste about the restaurant. What kind of wait staff makes the customer feel bad about a problem the wait staff has?   The food was good, but none of us will subject ourselves to this terrible service again.

VBDnLg7h_ms8-ULXOqvDxA.text: In business for over 30 years, this authentic Italian restaurant is one not to be missed. Linen tables and hometown Italian hospitality fill the restaurant. Oil vinegar and Bread came to the table within 15 seconds of our sitting. Gino, our fabulous waiter made us feel right at home. Get the Caesar salad with a parmesan crusted shell! Delicious. We had spaghetti ala o'glio. Not on the menu, but it's just garlic and oil sauteed over spaghetti. Excellent service, atmosphere and food. Ask for Gino, he's great:)

97smB0JCPvOQT03pvrURBQ.text: Excellent service & amazing food! I contacted Tomaso's a few months ago when I was searching for restaurants to host a surprise birthday dinner at. They have a few private dining rooms which is what I was looking for. Out of all of the 15+ places I contacted, this was the only one that did not have a minimum amount to reserve the room! I was shocked! Especially considering how nice this restaurant is & that smaller places were requiring $800 - $1500 minimum amounts. I worked with a lovely lady named, Vincenza, who responded to me quickly, stayed in touch throughout the weeks leading up to the party & made sure it was everything I wanted & more! All of the staff here are incredibly friendly & personable. Making all the guests laugh & feel comfortable! & of course I have to talk about the food! Amazing, homemade Italian dishes that are to die for! Thank you, Tomaso's & Vincenza for making the night so special & one that we will never forget! I will recommend you to everyone!

ccMnG8PGoV0Ps8ViYknlog.text: We showed up on Dec 30 after hearing so much about this place. Should have gone somewhere else. Ordered the lasagna and stuffed veal chop. Both items were lacking in taste and the veal was flabby. The manager, a very pleasant and professional young lady, immediately came over and offering other items. My wife ordered the salmon and I got the antipasto starter as my meal. Bottom line, will never go back nor do I recommend this restaurant.

IJieYxpuWhEXfx98ADdoEQ.text: Tomaso's is classic (northern) Italian in an old country setting, straight up. I was concerned after hanging around Little Italy for a month that Arizona's fare would not measure up. I was wrong.  Granted, we did not have the standard experience as we came on Christmas Eve, but the staff was friendly and warm. As we watched food being served, it seemed the same dishes kept coming up over and over again, which is good since our rookie order overlapped:  - Tuscan Legume Soup ($8): Enjoyable but otherwise unremarkable. - Mozzarella Caprese ($13): Sized for two and executed excellently. - Fish Roulade ($29): Special of the evening was fish rolled with crab and lobster meat over spinach with lobster ravioli. How can one go wrong? One can't. - Scampi Caprese & Lobster Ravioli ($28): I'd call this a miss but I'm in the minority as my parents both enjoyed it and most of the restaurant seemed to agree. - The Best Lasagna Ever ($24): A bold claim, but this really was the best lasagna I've had in a very long time - balanced flavors and not too heavy.  For dessert, an adequate tiramisu was heavily overshadowed in both size and preference by a monster cannoli.   Tomaso's is a little on the expensive side but one is clearly paying for quality of atmosphere, service and food. It meets the difficult bar of somewhere on which both my meat and potatoes parents and I can agree. For a special occasion (or on an expense account) I'd definitely drop in again.

GfkRpB8tvSeLJqV599Tfbw.text: Arrived around 8pm Oct 9 . There was no one at the hostess stand, waited a couple of  minutes until someone noticed us. Our server asked for our drink order and I asked for a taste of a couple wines so that we could decide which to order.  He asked two times 'so you want this one', no we we would like a taste to decide. he seemed very reluctant to follow through. We were planning to order a bottle, instead we ordered  2 glasses. We had carpaccio, nothing special.  For entrees we both had halibut and lobster ravioli.  My fish was dry, his moist. The ravioli was good but could have more lobster,  only a couple pieces the rest was filler.   Kept looking for our server abd didn't see him. Finally someone noticed that we were trying to get their attention. He said that the original server had left.  Would have been nice to know. Probably won't return.

YS8pw7sYOBqaW23FCOqecg.text: Tomasos did not dissapoint this NJ native during superbowl weekend.  Their drinks were poured accurately and plentiful.    With regards to the food, the order consisted of the below: BEEF CARPACIO CHOPPED SALAD TARFELLE PASTA AND MEATBALLS (SPLIT INTO TWO ORDERS) VEAL CHOP LAMB CHOPS. ICE CREAM  The two appetizers were both enjoyed and the size was what you would expect. Not large nor small.  The pasta dish was shared and tasted amazing.  My companion had the lamb and he typically gets that at restraunts.  He said the meat was a good cut and cooked perfectly.   I had a veal chop not found on the menu and due to my improvisation no sides are listed.  They decided to give me a gnocchi pasta and potatoes.  I thought the chop was a bit small; however the cut (taking into account fat ratio and placement to the meat) was amazing.  I have to also give credit where credit is due in mentioning it was broiled perfectly as well.  We went to The Missiin, Different Pointe of View, & Tomasos during our stay and I have to say while the others were both great...Tomasos would inch out ahead if I were to make a suggestion to a friend.

2IAFZaHZQjNa1QTmQQrq5Q.text: Besides being over-priced, the food wasn't good.  Meal was lukewarm and lacked taste.  Service was good, hence the 2 stars instead of 1.    We won't be back.

sg56goLoV48fdJtHl99bnA.text: Very Italian menu lots of fresh use of seafood.  I had the lamb meatballs and bolonegnese and it was fantastic and hearty. Also Veal Saltambucco and it was also fantastic. Too full for dessert here!

9vebYRSJ-rIY9JFr-RN27g.text: The new Tomasos just opened in our neighborhood off Pinnacle Peak and Scottsdale Rd. We made a reservation and were warmly greeted and promptly seated. Our waiter, Michael, arrived while we were looking over the menu and provided top notch service throughout the meal. Food was fresh and served piping hot which isn't always the case in other restaurants.  We shared the calamari which was tender and crisp along with a divine marinara sauce. My fettuccine con funghi was exceptional as was hubby's lemon veal. Run, don't walk, to dine here !

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fabulous!

939BMn-mauJb0qxAZaXwkQ.text: Wow, what a disappointment. My husband and I both work in the service industry and were super excited to FINALLY be able to spend Valentines Day together ON Valentine's Day, instead of having to work. I've told my husband numerous times about how Tomaso's butter squash ravioli brought tears to my eyes because it was sooooo amazing! I haven't been here in several years, so when he surprised me with dinner here for Valentines Day, I was so excited! The issues started when we were seated. We were greeted with water and bread in a timely manner, but everything else seemed to take FOREVER. We sat with the wine menu closed for a good 20 minutes before our server finally came to take our drink order. He walked by us several times in these 20 minutes, so we started to think that either he forgot we were his table, or he assumed we did not have the money to dine here because of our age (mid 20's and early 30's), therefore he simply didn't care to give us good service.  We ordered a couple glasses of wine, the calamari appetizer, the chicken parmigiana, and the nights special, cioppino (which I had to ask our server about because nobody informed us about specials, yet every table around us was ordering it). The calamari was bland and soggy. My husband ordered the chicken parm and was confused when it came out with broccoli and potatoes, when the menu specifically said it came with rigatoni (I even checked the menu on our way out). The sides were lukewarm and he found a hair in his food! I ordered the cioppino and it was boring to say the least. The shrimp were sandy and the mussels had a very STRONG fishy taste, which turned me off to the dish completely. Why didn't we send our food back? Because our server was nowhere to be found during our ENTIRE meal. Not once did he touch the table other than to take our order and bring the check. This was supposed to be a special night for us and was a total letdown. For $130 we expect decent service (at the least) and hot, fresh, hairless food. It's safe to say we will never come here again.

TpaUtvb8TIZSLL4yuGYFQg.text: Had an amazing evening and dinner at Tomaso's. Our server Joe made the overall experience so amazing that we can't wait to come back! His recommendations (veal bolognese & seafood tomato dish) were absolutely delicious. It was our two year anniversary and he made made it a point to treat us to a specialty dessert on the house. Service, food, experience, ambiance, and service are all a solid 10/10!! Thanks Joe!!

UZmSBpI7N77f51RLbT8xnw.text: We came here to celebrate one of my Dad's bigger birthday's and holy cow, I am so glad we did. When we came to decorate my dad's table, they graciously gave us one of their private rooms at no extra charge and even helped us with decorating. Our waiter, Aaron, was awesome! He helped us with the decorations, gave recommendations, and happily took pictures of us when asked. He felt like he was part of the birthday celebration! We had fantastic food: appetizers of calamari, squash blossoms, meatballs. I enjoyed homemade pasta with lobster and shrimp in a spicy tomato sauce-Scialatelli with Lobster, Shrimp & Pomodoro Piccante-what a treat, so tasty. There were so many yummy things to choose from, it was a hard choice! I enjoyed bites of other people's  Rigatoni Amatriciana & Meatballs, Tortelli Di Michalangelo Buonarotti, and Linguine Del Pescatore. I didn't have anything to drink but the cocktails, etc looked great. Aaron was also great about cutting the birthday cake. Did I mention what a fantastic waiter Aaron was?! Tomaso is lucky to have him on his team. In sum, this was the perfect choice to celebrate my dad's birthday. The whole night was impeccable: Delicious food, atmosphere, and service (i.e., Aaron). I'm glad we celebrated at Tomaso's and will gladly come eat here the next time I'm in town.

RUrd9zIdO2PYDwKQYYcOmw.text: Absolutely phenomenal meal. The salad was crisp and fresh and the dressing was flavorful. And it was dressed appropriately. Some places only put a few squirts but this was on all parts of the salad. I wanted to sip it up with the bread. The pasta course also had a delicious sauce, pasta a nice al dente with gave beans, artichokes and fresh peas. Moving on to the entree another delicious offering. The eggplant piled with ricotta and a marina with 3 delicious homemade butternut squash. Just the right amount of heat to balance the eggplant. The desert was two HUGE strawberries with a dollop of marscapone and a sprinkling of white and milk chocolate what tasted like a small malted milk ball. The waitstaff was attentive and kept all the glasses filled, the room temp comfortable, and the food delivered timely. Tomaso's has been here for years and the only thing that is hard is on a busy night if you don't valet parking lot is super small. But I would walk blocks to come here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. This was the strawberry dessert last night.

29C1vE24eRjjkqrX2j_tYQ.text: I think there's something to be said about going to a restaurant twice during our visit to Az. The food is amazing. The ossobucco is succulent and delicious. The cioppino was crazy wonderful. The staff is super friendly and my hubs loved the wine list. Tomaso's provide a wonderful dining experience. Believe me, the quality and taste of their food is something I won't forget.

Vm9dhyeeeEDvberWwXpzmw.text: Disappointing!  You would like on a Saturday night every restaurant would be in top form - not so.  My daughter and I were ignored by the wait staff - The tables with men at them were served promptly. We have been to Tomaso's and not had this problem before.  The food was just okay.  It was cold when it came to the table and had to be sent back. We will go back because this was the first time I can remember being disappointed and will give them another shot.

a_j8kVEn_LFOAJTxQrHMug.text: Great Restaurant with True homemade pasta and a great owner in Thomoso!  I had the pleasure of eating here last week while in Phoenix.  I had a wonderful wild mushroom Ragu with fresh fettuccini.  I also tried their salmon special, which was solid.  Just a light butter sauce, not over done.    I really had a nice experience here.  I will be back on my next visit to the area.

X8-M_qEsI56SdwMFmyULzw.text: I had the veal dish for lunch and throughly enjoyed it. The vegetables and potato's were cooked just right. I will be returning.

l6WzNsP_KvjcrktXplvH2Q.text: Great food and great service. The entire staff was friendly. The food came out fairly quickly especially considering that the restaurant was so busy. Our waiter was very attentive. Luckily, the service does not outshine the taste of the food. I got a pasta with shrimp and lobster and it was absolutely delicious. I loved it. My girlfriend got some sort of eggplant and she said it was really good. My mother in law got the lasagna and it was also super good. We didn't know much about this place but now I know I will recommend it to anyone who visits Phoenix.

pQm6454I1QLuJ_a59_4P4w.text: Food was dynamite, drinks were dynamite, service was dynamite, and the chocolate mousse was dynamite. The whole experience was really a 6 Star review but I can only do up to 5 stars. It truly was an authentic Italian food dining experience. I would highly recommend this place to anyone looking for an authentic Italian experience.

2qOXa5pcgoxZ8A0uzwTDvA.text: Mangia! Most excellent Italian food!  Enjoy a leisurely evening dining at Tomaso.  And try their wine - the one from his vineyard in Italy - amazingly fine.
