bhGUCSzdNzw8A03fXN9rwQ.text: Waited 2 hours for our main course.  Made 7:15 reservations for 4 of us.  Watched several groups who walked in after us get served.  Brought this to the attention of our waiter and hostess but still no food appeared until 9:40.  The restaurant was clearing out by the time we were served.    In the end, they comped our meal and wine brought dessert and a lovely chocolate liquor.  Tomaso came out and apologized at the finish of the evening as he was busy in the kitchen.  We were told we had a new waiter which added to the problems.  Such a disappointment for us locals because this is a great location, nice ambience (although a little too bright in main dining room).   We will stick with L'Amore, Franco's or Christos which offer a similar Menu but much tastier and more organized!!

uvd2J29re8MiI-iGR18tAA.text: EVERYONE GET THE LOBSTER RAVIOLI! Best Italian food I've had in a long time. Even though my mom and I weren't in the proper attire we were treated the same as everyone else. If I ever visit Arizona again, I'll be sure to stop by again!

t3juduAO42NFHw08j1qy_Q.text: Last night had dinner at Tomaso's.  Waiter was quite good, the braised short rib adequate-overly salty the accompanying gnochi very tasty, but the off menu special of butterflied shrimp and risotto with logostinos  was superb.  The MAJOR disappoint was the drinks.  I ordered vodka on the rocks with onions. I have had stronger water.  The vodka was clearly watered down.  In fact the only taste came from the 3 onions.  AND it was expensive.  Went to Tomaso's after seeing the chef on a local tv station. The restaurant was founded in 1977.  Being in business almost 39 years indicates acceptance by the going out to eat crowd.    Today I was told Tomaso's is known for watering the alcohol depending upon the owner's then mood.  Order wine can't water it down.  Go for the food not the bar you should be ok.

YiBCnCo2mhBxxZGDjuHC4A.text: Incredible food. Great service.   We ordered the seafood pasta and I can honestly say it was the best I ever had.    The dinner bread was fresh and perfectly baked with a butter spread to die for.  I came there for my moms birthday and was given an American Express card which after dinner was told they don't accept that card. I almost started crying but they were so wonderful about it and somehow figured it out for me.   It was raining very hard and the owner and manager both held menus over my mother's head so she wouldn't get wet.   Thank you for an incredible evening

WueSxgPqmVfmJU3QeUWJgQ.text: One of the best restaurants in a city with great restaurants, Tomaso's is both a classic in the area and has an ever-changing menu.  Service is exemplary, attentive without being intrusive. Meals are paced well, and whether I have an hour-long dinner or a three-hour dinner, it never feels rushed.  Menu items change regularly, though cult favorites - spaghetti and meatballs, for one, and the sole - are almost always available. A particular joy is the fresh-daily ravioli, which is tremendously wonderful each time.  Off-menu items, both specials and requests, are often available. Our waiter summed it up one time by saying "If we have the parts, we'll make the dish." We've put that to the test a few times, and they always deliver.  A really good wine list, particularly rich in Barolo.  Highly, highly recommend.

R4k2JHbgNet_Y7YFiviSzw.text: Great place and wonderful food! The waiters are fantastic and the whole setting really gives off an authentic feeling.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken and eggplant and gnocchi!!

ZoLop8LYcuLkJ1k1nk3ztw.text: Went to the new Tomaso's location in North Scottsdale tonight and the service was so bad I walked out . After 20 minutes nobody asked us if we wanted a drink or anything. There were only four tables occupied in the entire restaurant and nobody would wait on us .  Absolutely the worst customer service I have experienced in a restaurant. There are too many good restaurants in North Scottsdale to waste your time on Tomaso's .

ZK5HOwUnwo0vFodfX2TUyQ.text: Best Italian restaurant I have visited since moving to the valley. The last visit was on 9/17/2017 at 5PM. Our welcoming server, Erin Patrick, made our party of 5 feel like family. Explained with precise detail how plates were prepared and even offered to modify any selection to our taste. I nearly slipped off my comfortable chair when he stated "if any of you have a favorite Italian dish and you don't see it on the menu just tell me and I will make it for you." All 5 of us had different menu options with each of us so in love with our meal choice we were passing spoonfuls of our meal to another saying "try this-it is so good." May be a bit pricey for pasta meals, however you will not feel taken, but blessed to feel special by being in an old world Italian home for a Sunday family meal at grandma's table. I will be driving from Surprise across the valley to dine here again. Great place for a romantic meal with your special friend where quiet conversation, hand holding, and staring at each other's eyes seem very much appropriate.

4gX_HmVoHszmieHrcPCEVg.text: Food here is so good.   The Atmosphere is just average all white tablecloth and open room.  Can be A little noisy. But food wise it's one of the best Italian places you can find in PHX

KX98jshGAxMpFVGICLHIfg.text: This is the best Italian food I have ever had. The service was alright and the ambiance was okay, but the food was to die for. The flavors were melt in your mouth delicious. It was as if we walked straight into Italy. I got the eggplant and butternut squash raviolis with swordfish (a special) and, let me tell you: no regrets. Don't pass on the bread either: the pesto garlic butter is. I don't have a better word other than deliciousness. It was as if the angels of heaven have handcrafted this meal. I would recommend to everyone I know. Best Italian food I have had in all of Arizona. Maybe it was just the dish I ordered, or the day I came in, but I'm telling everyone I know about this place.

CsgfXTCLF2DZnHLjymx_HQ.text: It's okay. Extremely expensive and wait staff mediocre. I got a fish special and I've had way better for way less. You're paying for the location and there are much better places for a similar experience at a much better price point. Only go here as a last resort for overpriced italian.

oeowRN8STR3Jf8_E4QDVbg.text: The food and services were exceptional, fantastic wine list. The large dining room in the back could have better ambience ( i.e. dim the bright lights!) but that is the only small improvement. A great evening and the food could not have been better.

_Cr0x3b5CYNIM5a9LeZZ9Q.text: I have reviewed Tomaso's in the past and am providing an update from our dinner last night. We have been visting Tomaso's for many years -whenever we come to Phoenix, and Tomaso's remains one of our favorite Italian restaurants in the entire country. I am from Brooklyn, grew up in an Italian neighborhood, and have traveled the US extensively, always looking for great Italian food (so rare in the West).  It happened to be restaurant week, so I did not order my usual veal chop caprese. Saw one gentleman eating his monstrous veal  bone (under $40), and I was jealous. But the restaurant week deal at $33 was simply too good to pass up.  Starting with a stuffed zucchini blossom and a slice of buffalo mozzarella with tomato and basil, with their crisp bread - awesome. Our entrees were lamb osso bucco with risotto - so good, and a duo of layered eggplant parm and butternut squash raviolis with sage butter.  Every single component of our meals was amazing.  Dessert choices were the angel's kisses and tiramisu - we tried both and were in heaven ourselves ending this wonderful meal.   Tomaso himself was in Italy leading a wine tour, so we missed him, but did have a DOCB Tuscan chianti which while pricy was superb.  Bravo! Tomaso's has been doing their magic for over 40 years. Enough said.

PrJbIaYuJZfo1so8iBCQAA.text: This place is terrific. Several of us were on a work trip and came here for dinner. We came last year too and made it a point to return. We ordered a variety of apps and entrees and everything was great. I had  veal osso bucco, wow !  The seafood platters were also a big hit as were spaghetti and meatballs. Drinks, desserts, the works were also enjoyed. I loved the lemoncello. Good service.

BsGCZkjttrQBWizwdEtYmg.text: This was our first time here, and I have to say it was very good! We had a very attentive and knowledgeable about the dishes and wine. The food was outstanding; so flavorful and just he right amount. Would definitely go here again, and recommend it to our friends and family.

xxDYqidfZuAlXxLNbq9DpA.text: Just finished having lunch. This was our first time there. I ordered the spinach linguini with the Alfredo /truffle sauce; my husband ordered the linguine with clam sauce. Our waiter was Gabriel. Our table no 13. Maybe that was the reason I was served orange tagliatelle instead of spinach??? And a thick sauce that had no truffle flavor whatsoever??? Maybe that's why the waiter did not come back within the traditional minute to check whether we were happy and basically ignored our table until I had one noodle left on my plate? And when asked why the spinach was red said because the pasta was from Valentines Day (5 days ago???). It tasted ok but was not what I ordered at all. No apologies, no prior warning about the pasta, which because of its wide shape does not work with a glue paste like sauce??? My husband liked his dish. We spent 38 bucks on a lunch dish I can whip up in 12 minutes flat for 5 bucks. I am shocked by the unprofessional treatment most of all. Lastly, I wanted just Gelato for dessert. They have it as a component in one of their 10-12 dollar desserts, so just serving a scoop should not be a problem. Well, they couldn't do it. The restaurant had about 4 parties to serve at the time, so why not get things right? Huge disappointment! BTW, I happen to be Italian. And no, this place is NOT. This is evident from the fact that they serve Alfredo sauce in the first place. Definitely not a dish any real Italian restaurant in Italy would serve. And they wouldn't dare to make that sauce out of the ingredients of Cesar's salad dressing, which, BTW is Mexican. The only reason I'm giving this 2 stars is that my husband 's food was good. Overall, feel ripped off.

-gLfwWK7v3p8RfxhJdZyqg.text: When we lived in Paradise Valley we used to go to Tomaso's often but we moved further away and it had been a few years since our last visit.    So happy to be able to say again, Tomaso's remains one of Phoenix's best Italian restaurants.  We went with some friends on Christmas Eve and the service was friendly, attentive...excellent.  The food was as good, if not better than we remembered.  All four of us loved the service, loved the environment and couldn't stop complimenting the food.   By comparison, we had been invited to Christo's Italian restaurant a few months earlier and that dining experience did not remotely compare, in any way, to Tomaso's.    I highly recommend Tomaso's.  We loved it so much...we're going back on New Years Eve.

tO9WgXMk0GXghzL52HXzKA.text: Just ate there and felt compelled to leave a review. Service was top notch and felt like a little get away. Almost felt like I wasn't in Phoenix anymore. Really liked the food as well!!

wUqDAiXLh9KX6zn4KCZ_bg.text: Poor choice for Italian when in Phoenix.  Average food and poor service.  I seldom give 2's.

S7fuVo-yXG3RUDjXENA6-w.text: I sat at the bar. In the bar area.  Very nice and quiet.  First class all the way. The staff really went out of there way to make me comfortable. The wine list is amazing.  The food. Just the right amount per portions  highly recommend. Any day of the week.

Nl_sCYMpxD5z-zOpj8sm4A.text: I came here a while back, had great experience and service. Thought I would come here for Thanksgiving since we don't cook at our house, big mistake!!! We arrived at 2:00 pm, wait for an hour, so I have to stand up and complain to one of the hosts. The waiter came over begrudgingly without any apology, said our food will come out shortly. Another half an hour went by, and we barely got the second course. The main course around in another half an hour. We finished our main dish after we spent 2 hrs here, and still haven't had the dessert yet. I understand that it is a busy day, however there are a few tables that came after us and got food served before us, wtf??!! Will never set my foot back in this place again, don't recommend it!!  Take your money elsewhere, Phoenix has too many great restaurants and good service to deal with all of this bullshit, bye Felicia!!

5VI4cK71pVQv7ikhJzXB7A.text: Always a good experience. Tonight Aaron was able to provide a great dining experience. Finding somebody educated in the restaurant industry is rare these days

AVxm6bP5y0SKC363B2nv8w.text: This place has great food!  This place is a staple for a working lunch but I don't know why more people don't come here at night.   I was there mid week around 8 and the place was almost empty. Two friends and I ate at the bar because it was a little too quiet in the dining room. I've been coming here for 10-15 years and the bartenders are always great.   Martinis to start. Big honest.  Caesar. Parmesan bowl. Killer croutons. Anchovies on request. Awesome.   The bartender recommended the lasagna with a side of homemade sausage. Un fn believable! So so so good. Cheesy. Lots of meat sauce. Home made pasta.   I've had almost every main dish and have never been disappointed. The pasta dishes are perfectly al dente and the chicken veal dishes are perfectly cooked with excellent sauces. The service is old school and always excellent.   The decor is a little dated but that's the only negative.

smboPp3iexP6m9SdPFJAtw.text: Love this place. I always come here for lunch with my Dad. The staff is very friendly and treats us like family. Food is absolutely amazing. Lots of options for Pescatariantarians like us. 10/10 recommend.

QbCmM88T6sYK32KioYhxmA.text: Delicious food! Friendly staff and great service! Lovely atmosphere! Can't wait to go back and try more yummy dishes! :-)

4hhk4Cb11fdQyrbWnEEtjg.text: This is a staple of anyone who appreciates the culinary offerings in the Phoenix/Scottsdale area. Open since 1977, this fine establishment exudes class, quality, and more than anything else, exceptional, heart-warming Italian food.   Enjoy a bottle of wine or two on a romantic date night, casual dinner with friends, or a sturdy drink when you post up at the bar.   The food is phenomenal and I cannot recommend this place highly enough. Truly a must on any foodie's list of restaurants in the area!

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The best meal in the place, the mixed grill

3lYwTCIBrCJu8cM7v-NBxQ.text: Dined here on Friday June 9th. Had made reservations, but no need as the restaurant wasn't busy. Many empty tables! A shame!  Started with drinks & ordered the Friend Calamari. They also offered a special which was an artichoke w/ zucchini flower. We ordered that as well but unfortunately they were out of artichokes. Ended up getting that special minus the choke with a few extra zucchini flowers. Those zucchini flowers were amazing, stuffed with mozzarella cheese & deep fried. Calamari was standard.  Caesar salad nice presentation, served in a Parmesan cheese bowl, no croutons. Again, standard in taste! I had the ravioli trio: which was an evening special. Three different samples of three types of raviolis. A tortellini in a butter sauce, a mushroom truffle w/ truffle oil , & a pear pecorino. This pear pecorino was heavenly! My husband has the seafood pasta with squid ink pasta. He seemed to like his meal- However, he sampled mine & would have preferred that! Our colleague had the lobster bisque soup which he enjoyed and the Paccheri Amalfitani.  A downside to the experience. The wait staff wanted to CLEAR our table constantly! We were relaxing, enjoying conversation with our business associate during all the stages of our meals. We were interrupted often by the many bussers that where either trying to grab our plates we hadn't finished, taking plates without asking or asking if we were finished when we clearly weren't?! Our butter was swiped off the table before we even got to taste the complementary bread, had to ask for another.To many employees on staff for how unoccupied the room was. Our waiter was fine; with that said, paying for the atmosphere & fancy flare is another. In our observation  it's extremely pricey for the portions & was not as memorable as we would have wished for.

QcpUUC5lTV8SmnE7xkeSxA.text: Went with my girlfriends for restaurant week. The salmon bruschetta and caprese were very good. But the Sole Picatta was delicious. My friend order lasagna which was made with a bechemel sauce and was very tasty. The lamb osso bucco was fall off the bone yummy

35ySjTJpyXMQ9BTNi42JSg.text: I'm torn on if this should be a 3 star for me but honestly? I want to be impressed, but I just wasn't. My husband took me her for Valentines Day because the Lon's at the Hermosa (our favorite) was booked. Our waiter wasn't very good although he caught himself it seemed. I just figured he must not have a high respect for women due to his age and accent. Im not going to pick this review all apart but I did like the lady who sold us our bottle of wine and I liked my orange roughie. The balloons on the ceiling looked tacky and would have looked nicer if a curly string was at least attached. It was just a bad valentine decor, bad valet, bad service but great wine. It was my first time and I'm sure my last. I'm really disappointed and wouldn't ever recommend this restaurant.

zlGNBhl_2-DWsI6CJOhGfQ.text: The best thing about this place is the authenticity of the menu and service.  Our server made some amazing recommendations from the stuffed squash blossoms to the cream puffs for dessert.  I had the Osso Buco di Maialino and it was great. I didn't even need a knife because it was melting off the bone.  My partner had the seafood pasta special and it was a bit disappointing. The lobster was overcooked and so was the majority of other shellfish on the plate. The sauce was really good but the other stuff was just meh.  I would definitely love to try it out again. The spaghetti with meatballs looked awesome.

tkAS8BdS-JDc62f6fv5nVw.text: Holy amazingness!!!!!! If I lived in the area, this would be my favorite spot!!! I can't tell you what dish I enjoyed the most: the ravioli was to die for, the lobster risotto was the best I've ever had, and the steak, lamb, and sausage main course nearly had me in tears for savoring every bite. If you are ever in Phoenix you must check out this landmark restaurant! My pops could not rave enough about his gluten-free pasta!! Thanks Tomaso for foodie's dream night of eating!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tomaso greeting my pops and me. Such a great chef and sweet man!!!
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Lamb, steak, sausage deliciousness

_W2gGusbsTIg4yP6zT4sxQ.text: If you know real Italian then Tomaso's is where you want to eat. The owner Tomaso himself has created a menu and environment with a real Italian fare. I have been eating here for years and have never left disappointed. Matter of fact I dined their last night and left with a stuffed belly and a sole on my face.   I sat at the bar which had the football game playing. The bartender was friendly and knowledgeable of the items only the menu. Tomaso was in the house as well. Always friendly and comes by to greet the patrons. I was given some warm fresh homemade bread with some of Tomasos own brand of fresh olive oil. By the way it is the best. He makes his own olive oil and various types of wines which are presented in a full stocked bar.   What I like most is he offers more then he typical Italian resturant options and seasonal dishes. There is something for all dietary needs. I have some food allergies and this Resturant will customize your order.   There is a small room for private parties that can be closed off to the patrons. Decorate classy with top notch customer service.

CI0GXaoIQn-ykYBD1-xaxA.text: Would give 3.5 stars. Food good but not great. Sauce for mussel appetizer was bland. Same with osso bucco & rissoto. Spouse had special: seafood ravioli & orange roughy. Fish nicely prepared but needed more sauce. Didn't care for seafood ravioli or sauce on it. Arugula pear salad was delicious. Ceasar salad was good but had better. Portions for all courses were quite generous with exception of tiramisu desert. Was delicious but very small serving. They do make a great cappicino. Atmosphere nice, service very good. Prices moderately expensive. Don't think we'll go again-better Italian places out there.

y621z8wSTBxuAVloHF9Cqg.text: This place is amazing! Went here on Thursday to check out the new summer menu specials and it did not disappoint. We failed to make reservations but were offered a short wait time or the full service bar. Opted for the bar as I couldn't wait to get my mouth on a decent chianti - yum! We enjoyed squid ink seafood pasta, decadent lobster raviolis, and a strawberry cream dessert. Can't wait to be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp Marsala and lobster ravioli. Don&#39;t forget the wine!

euiUMJR6qgWej9Vxp2qQ5g.text: A few friends joined me at the bar last night and we had a very nice experience.  Tomaso was there but spent most of his time watching over the kitchen and serving staff - as he should.  After 40 years he has opened this second location in North Scottsdale.  While we have a handful of other Italian restaurants in close proximity, I can comfortably predict this will become the local favorite.   A few kinks need to be worked out, but that's perfectly understandable being open for just a few days.  We saw a server move the bowl of grated parmesan cheese from one person that just finished his spaghetti to another that just had some arrive.  That's not like a bottle of ketchup and should not be shared amongst customers.  I know fresh grated parmesan reggiano is expensive and shouldn't be wasted - but the server should sprinkle it on the food for the customer and take it away - unless that customer requests to keep it.   Everyone I spoke to loved their food.  His prices are about 10-20% lower than Spiga, Pane e Vino and Gianfranco's nearby.  The only complaint I hear over & over again was his high prices for cocktails.  My rum & coke cost $11.00.  Only nearby Mastro's charges that high a price, but it's a much more generous pour at Mastro's.  Most other high quality restaurants in the area charge between $7-$8 for the same drink.  Tomaso needs to address this because his 30+ seats at the bar will generate at least 20-25% of his business in this part of town if he does it right. Finally, I noticed a few staffers that came from other restaurants in the area.  The waiter John was with Pane e Vino for 15 years.  I stopped going there a few years ago because of the new owner, but missed having John wait on us.  I was sure glad to see him again.  A True professional!  Good luck Tomaso.  We're glad you're here.

A5jFoZwZLO2gICqk2loI-w.text: My wife and went here for our first time on her Birthday and we were not let down. This place had great food, some of the best we have had in  a long time. If you enjoy great food this is the place to go, we will be returning.

Zmcb7PDcgvLkd34Qqrp9Bg.text: I'm visiting Arizona from Chino Hills California. We were directed to Tomaso's authentic Italian restaurant. Wow, excellent cuisine. I had the pistachio covered salmon and husband had the filet mignon ravioli. Masoud our waiter represents the epitome of a fine connoisseur. Excellent all around experience.

Nfz6fizSF_px4cHsRh6RNw.text: Came here for dinner for Arizona restaurant week. We had a very good dinner. I ordered the stuffed squash blossoms, the roulade of veal and for desert i got the chocolate caramel crunch. The wife got the roasted beet salad, the filet and the tiramisu.   Everything about my meal was very good. Was very surprised at how good the veal was. The desert was a little rich but none the less still delicious.  My wife enjoyed hers as well but neither of us was impressed with the filet, it just didn't seem very tender. But her tiramisu was delicious.  This was our 2nd time eating here and both times have been good experiences.

FPO0ftAtckHETYv21rbFQA.text: Delicious food but rude servers. We didn't like him so we left a tip accordingly. After ten minutes Our server came outside to stop us halfway of the parking lot to tell us we left a bad tip and asked us "was there something wrong about my service?" Ended up telling us he didn't like us. It was as if we had no right to leave the cost of our tip. It's how we felt about the service and I don't think we should be judged for it. But food was good. Just hope you don't have the old Italian man with a pony tail as your server. He may chase you out the door to complain about your tip.

9jKkrQ6fmwLHOHoIF89dHg.text: Happened upon this restaurant as we were visiting from out of town. My husband had the grilled filet mignon and said it was one of the best he's ever had. I had the cavatelli with lamb meatballs. It was to die for. There was no fettuccini on the menu but the server had some prepared for the kids. The noodles were so fresh and light. Happy family here!

AcBHEEbtSP4RlubeewdTmg.text: The fried calamari was great but the service and the seafood linguini special and the wedding soup were a 3 stars. We were not impressed at all.

i_wQmTR63DgPic5emEcLbw.text: Good but not mind blowing good!  Our waiter was very attentive. Always checked on us and made good recommendations. Service = 5 stars!  As for the food, it was a mixed feeling for us. It was good and decent. The complimentary bread and herb butter was delicious. We had also ordered the lobster bisque as well. Good but my bf wasn't too into it!! Calamari were cooked well but we felt the sauce could use a touch more seasoning. My dish, the Amazing Spinach blah blah blah (long name; essentially spinach pasta and braised short ribs) was okay. My pasta was not cooked evenly, some I felt was still under. I was hoping to be wowed since I've heard so much about their freshly made pasta. Maybe I went in with too high of expectation?! The price + my dish yields them 3 stars from me.

-92-PkWYLE8EFm9P3VZqjg.text: This Italian restaurant was pleasant, and fairly decent by Arizona standards. The Pasta was properly cooked and the portions of meat and pasta were average. I've had far worse in this state. We ate here in 2014.   I've eaten at a number of Italian restaurants in the Phoenix Metro area, but have decided not to anymore. I grew up in the New York/New Jersey Metro area, and the quality of Italian restaurants in that part of the country, whether a famous  place or a ma and pa hole in the wall, is absolutely outstanding. Arizona has quite a number of Italian eateries that impress people here, but to me, given where I grew up, it's just a disappointment. I love Arizona for a vast number of reasons, but Italian food is not one of them.   I suppose this statement may anger some people in Scottsdale, the West's most Eastern town, but it stands. I have had outstanding Italian food in the Phoenix metro area, but home cooked in people's homes, none of them chefs, and not all of them Italian.

_Y8T96O5-ySY9lag2EWVfw.text: I have been meaning to visit this place for years. I'm not sure why I put it off but eventually I tried it for a business dinner. The service was excellent, food incredible and the wine/cocktails were very complementary. I will be back and I'll be bringing more clients. Stellar experience.

OhuS6gDPFigqE9PvPjIGWA.text: Food is good... Service can be slow.  We sat down and it was at least 10-15 minutes before the waiter came over.  Then, we ordered an appetizer (mozzarella tasting board - very good).  After we finished the app, the dirty plates were not taken away despite people coming by or passing the table repeatedly until our dinner showed up.  Disappointed.

QHE4XU5xNfRlEE2cYHSHAA.text: This is the Mother Ship for Italian restaurants.  I've been dining at Tomaso's for the past 13 years and I always know I can count on perfection.  The restaurant is comfortable, clean and the food outstanding.  The food is authentic Italian and if I could give the quality of each and every meal a higher rating than 5 stars, I would give it a 10!  Their portions are generous and Tomaso oversees each dish that leaves his kitchen.  He is a hands on owner who greets his customers with open arms.  His staff follows his perfection as well.  Christmas Eve, New Year's Eve, Valentine's Day or any day, this restaurant always amazes me with their menu.  There are many choices and they are never boring.  It is truly a favorite of mine.  If you're a sports nut, you will find many familiar faces at this establishment.

xOg2ariKXbklewZgW70GUQ.text: From the options to taste to service to ambiance, I loved this small Italian restaurant! I had the eggplant and squash ravioli and loved it! They also have a great wine list and some different desserts you do not see at every Italian restaurant. I have only been once when visiting for work, but I would go again the next time I am in town!

7w15obni-ypOluXMI8wi5g.text: The food was amazing!!  Service was great.  Atmosphere was a little lacking-several tables nearby talking loudly-not very quiet or relaxing experience.  But the food made up for it!

_KBOr2jZRd9E7rng53cSMw.text: The food is excellent, however, I think we may have gotten their worst server. He walked away halfway through our orders and generally avoided our table. My boyfriend even saw him point at us while he was talking to another server which was completely unprofessional. I had higher hopes for this place but it was ultimately a disappointing experience.

eXq0hpnVP06ZrSKeKsFtuQ.text: Been eating here for several years. It just gets better and better. Tonights New York Strip Bistecca with Chimichurri is the best steak Ive ever had. Tomaso knows how to bring food together like nobody else.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. New York Strip Bistecca with Chimichuri. This IS the best steak I have ever had. I subbed spinach instead of potatoes.

Aymvi0u_q-jiYHrASMx-yA.text: Loved this restaurant. Ate here with co workers one night when it was recommended by a friend that lives in Phoenix. The place is in a strip mall with decent parking but likely easier to valet than self park. But when we walked in it reminded me of an old New York Italian restaurant. The building itself appeared to be quite old and I fully expected to smell that faint smoke smell that you get in those old NYC restaurants. It did not smell like smoke but the ambience was cool. When you first walk in there is a bar in front of you with some seating and a large dining room to the right. We sat at a table for 10 in the dining room. What hit me immediately was our waiter you could tell was a professional. He knew everything on the menu, could comment on how it was all cooked, and gave a lot of suggestions. He was an excellent salesman also. We found out later that night he had worked in Italian restaurants (or this restaurant) for 30 years. We received excellent customer  service the entire night.  The food was excellent also. I can't comment on the entire group but I had homemade pasta and red sauce. My two neighbors had veal and praised it as much as I did my pasta. Really top notch spot that I will return to next time in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

1g0jK-mNHxP3sUQ3a65tEQ.text: Old school fine dining Italian, and simply one of the best restaurants in Phoenix. Consistent high quality, and love the well chosen selection of wines by the glass.

MiaL-KVSWYgwmQ1wpmIJMQ.text: A must go!  You go once you will become a regular.  Food atmosphere authentic and classic!!!!

2ex3Vltx2xwaFjU2VNyLGA.text: Anthony is the best bartender/server/ recommends the best dishes and wine.  Here for a corporate dinner....amazing!

nmfxx_27aesOR2uYAtqy1g.text: We had a delightful evening. Food, service, timing, ambience were perfect. This is a very expensive restaurant that provides polished dining.

fPnNU7o5U2g8WafYRVUbVg.text: Never would have expected great Italian food in the desert, but this is one.  The fresh bread with fresh ground parmesan was wonderful.  The antipasto has some of the best prosciutto I have had.  A must is the veal scaloppini, tender and full of flavor.  This is a must for Italian in the Scottsdale area.

YpLk--P0qPS2Hzp8THNmXg.text: Tomaso's has just taken the spot of my number one Italian restaurant this side of San Francisco. I was lucky to have been taken there by my husband a week or so ago for a date night. Tomaso's was booked solid so I was excited he scored a reservation. We decided to arrive a little early and have a glass of wine at the quaint bar. The list is ample with lots of varietals of wines. The bartender was very friendly and accommodating. At our reservation time we were shown to our table. I was surprised how large the restaurant was when our table was in the 'back' of the restaurant. It just seems smaller from the street! Tomaso's is all class with white linen tables and napkins and squared tables. Our waiter greeted us and shared the nights specials: Cioppino and a Veal Chop served Parmigiana style over pasta. Being from the bay area, winning me over with cioppino can be difficult.. so, in truth, I was skeptical. We started with the Charcuterie Antipasto  plate with various Italian salumi; Italian cheeses; olives and amazing grilled artichoke hearts.Our waiter also brought us a basket of house made warm crusty bread and a garlicky basil butter; this was divine. Despite Tomaso's being full on reservations this particular night we were not rushed while we sipped our Super Tuscan wine and nibbled on the charcuterie. The grilled artichokes are knock your socks off good! Finally, after much deliberation, we decided to order. I had to have the Lobster Bisque that was described as having diced lobster within it.. This bisque is heavenly if you like creamy, hearty soups like me. It was rich and filling and full of lobster. On this particular night a Chicken Parmigiana was being served and as much as I wanted to try the Cioppino, (as it was served next to us and it was amazing looking with what looked like an entire lobster tail !), I went with one of my favorites! My husband ordered my second favorite : Maialino Osso Buco. I can't even begin to describe how amazing both dishes were . My meal was very ample in amount and my husband's shank was so tender it was falling off the bone. We both had leftovers to take home! We were so full we did not have desserts and continued to enjoy this very relaxed and mainly, unrushed romantical night out at Tomaso's. I simply was amazed by how great the service was; how we were never rushed on this very popular night ; how awesome the food was and it's presentation, as well. Tomaso's was all I had hoped for on a night out to celebrate a milestone in our relationship with my now husband and they helped make it perfect! I can't wait to return to savor more Italian food here soon!

mKnx9GmBbgGVJIld1LFo8Q.text: We found this place by searching online for good Italian food in Phoenix. It seems more upscale than it is. You don't have to be super dressed up to come here, but I wouldn't recommend walking in with flip flops and a tank top.  Everything that I tried here was amazing. Even starting with the bread with the herb butter. I could not stop eating it!! It was so good, and the bread stayed warm the entire time we sat there. I order the short rib with the mushroom risotto, while my aunt ordered the caesar and the lasagna. My 7 year old cousin ordered spaghetti and meatballs because well she's 7. Everything we had was so flavorful. The caesar salad is made with the a parmesan shell, so you get that nice bite of crisp cheese.  The short rib was fork tender, there was no need for any knives at this table. The lasagna....OMG perfect mix of tomato, cheese, and meat. This is probably the first time that I can remember in a long time that I didn't need to add salt and pepper to a dish. It was perfectly seasoned from the first bite. The hardest thing I would say here is to decide what you want to eat because everything looks good.   Of course, we had to do a dessert so I had a cannoli, while they shared a bombolini (?) . Whatever they had was great, but it didn't hold a candle to my cannoli with espresso.   I can't leave this review without mentioning that the service from start to finish was amazing. They were very kind, welcoming, and informative. I can't wait to go back the next time I'm in Phoenix.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Cannon with Espresso
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bambolini
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Kids Spaghetti and Meatballs

5qAyWiWm5wLDLTr8AQ60VQ.text: I visited Tomaso's with my brother and fiance, while my fiance and I were visiting from out of town. We really wanted a nice Italian dinner on our last evening in town, and Tomaso's did not disappoint! It's not the trendy American-Italian (which I actually really enjoy) - its more old-school, white tablecloth style. Both are awesome in their own way!  Our server, Arturo, was amazing. He was really helpful with recommendations and we didn't feel rushed at all. We were probably there for over two hours... which is fine by me when doing this style of dining. Our appetizer, Crudo Carpaccio, was a steal at $12 and a great way to start the meal. We each ordered different items with the Osso Buco being the favorite at the table. It was so flavorful and unbelievably tender.   For dessert we had cannoli, profiteroles, and tiramisu - you can't go wrong with any of them. They were all so good!  If you're looking for a traditional Italian spot, check out Tomaso's! We'll be back!

9WWqFfRG1iKZV_xDkJInmg.text: This place was v good.   The tuna linguine was hands down the best I ever had.  The view on the way here isn't bad on the eyes either!

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

IFY6u8I5THgTgSF5ff690w.text: The food was great but the problem is with the service. I read a couple of reviews in the same regard. They come and clear the plates before every one on the table is done. This put people at a very awkward position that makes them stop finishing their plate. Very very bad.  To make up the food was real Italian. I have been to Italy more than 50 times. Today I felt I was there except for this.

DFVN_ISp9AQSUj83TdxxOw.text: While the food was good, the service was lacking.  We had a 5:30pm reservation and there were only three other tables with people at that time.  I couldn't tell you the waiter's name because he never told us.  Although he made a recommendation of one of the daily specials, he barely spoke to us and always seemed to be in a hurry to leave our table to do something else.  We actually had to try to find him to order a second round of drinks and dinner and he never once came back to see how we were doing or if our food was ok.  He didn't come back until we were done and the bus boy had cleared our table.  Truly unacceptible.  I will say the meatball appetizers was great!  They clearly do veal well as there were four or five veal options.  I had veal medallions which were one of the daily specials.  They were extremely tender and great taste.  The potatoes and asparagus were so-so.    Normally we order desert, coffee or after dinner drinks, but opted to get the check and go since the service was lousy.    It was also frustrating this parking lot had one handicapped parking spot right in front of the restaurant (family member in wheelchair) and right were the valet parking attendants stand. I asked if I could park there and the attendant told me he would park the car. A little annoying I have to tip someone to move my car five feet.  And a little surprising the two valet attendants stood there chatting while I got the wheelchair out of the trunk.  We valet the car often and most of the time the attendants help me with the chair, especially when we are dressed for dinner at a descent resteraunt.   To sum it up, good food, but with all the options we have in Phoenix now, we won't waste our time going back to Tomaso's ever again.

09eQCNM81ic1h5rAKZcCXA.text: Every time my family and I come to this restaurant, our FAVORITE waiter Tom is so courteous and treats us so wonderfully. He knows what we like and is just an absolute delight!

gwQUVRvRs160MxPyWx40KA.text: My husband surprised me with a date night that included dinner at Tomaso's. I'm 2 months postpartum, so it was a special event for us. Everything about our dinner exceeded 5 stars. The service and the food were amazingggggg. Aaron was our waiter and he was very knowledgeable about the food and wine menus. His recommendation was the lemon veal piccata, so that's what I ordered. It was out of this world flavorful and tender. I'm eating my leftovers now, and I want to cry as I'm currently taking my last bite. Sooo delicious. The portions were large, so you most definitely get more bang for your buck!  My husband ordered the chicken parm, and he loved it as well!! If you love red wine, try the Tomaso family blend. It made for a happy palate. Thank you, Aaron and staff at Tomaso's for making our night special!  We will most definitely be back to try other things on the menu!

KgPnsHscKhMRvx4sldMdpw.text: Tomaso's is a great old-school, white tablecloth, non-stuffy Italian place. I'm not Italian, but my fiance and soon to be bro-in-law are, and this is the kind of place that their grandfather would take them to. We were in from Pittsburgh visiting, and wanted to have a nice dinner and bottle (or two) of wine before we left town. Tomaso's didn't disappoint. From the Crudo Carpaccio to the Osso Buco to the Cannolis, tiramisu, etc. the whole meal was absolutely delicious!   Our server, Arturo, was very helpful along the way, and we ended up telling family stories and spent 2+ hours at the restaurant. At no point did we feel rushed to get out of the restaurant. It was a fantastic evening, and we will certainly be back when in town!

ppWpr6FQztaBA-3bCQVpaA.text: Took my girlfriend here for our anniversary, everything tasted great but I would have to say that the server was a bit rude maybe because we were young but, he gave us a dirty look when we told him we didn't want wine.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

OcK_UcbQ7TFPT-HpGNs2og.text: Mediocre and totally overpriced. I honestly can't believe they're able to charge as much as they do. For $24 I'd expect fresh pasta and thick, flavorful sauce, but I could've made the same thing at home. Oh, and $24 was for one plate, not family style. My party all had different items and they were all subpar. The service was crazy slow too - we had to ask for service twice. You'd be better off at Buca di Beppo... or if you want gourmet food that's worth your time, try Tarbell's next door.

CHcsVSI6jNPdiBLQD3HH9A.text: Really, really good Italian food and wine.  Can be a bit stuffy of a vibe sometimes, but that is somewhat due to the area they are in.  The butter that comes with the bread is amazing, and then I'd recommend the pasta bolognese that has the mushrooms in it

4zGp-7LrTvJvi6drzLFd-Q.text: 70$ for the two off us that included eggplant and gnocci that tasted like the olive garden.  My wife said her meal was good, but I was seriously disappointed.  If I'm paying 25$ for a plate of pasta, you better give me food orgasms.  Well, olive garden tasting food was far from it, plus the parking situation is a joke.

4OYLu2JmORyD54VS9GpUaw.text: My fiancee and I ate here last night. We're testing out places for a rehearsal dinner. The parking lot is a bit confusing during dinner since the valet cones off the lot. If you enter from the Camelback side you might have to squeeze through a sign and a cement column to get to valet. The interior of the restaurant is ok, seems a bit dated but not too bad. Our experience seemed to be a bit rushed. It felt like as soon as our plates were cleared then next course was on the table. The bread and I assume pesto butter was delightful. The service was OK  but the waiter seemed to rush us and did not really explain any of the menu or tell us the daily vegetable. We had lobster bisque was decent, not the best I've ever had. The dish was so hot that it burned my tongue. For our main dishes, we had the mixed grill and the ribbon pasta with mushroom and truffle. The mixed grill comes with a link of in house made sausage, lamb chops, and a filet. The portions were decent. The waiter neglected to ask me how I would like my filet when I ordered, so it came out well done and the taste of the beef not pleasurable. The best thing by far of the night was the lamb chop. It was seasoned well and cooked to perfection. The sausage link was so-so. My fiancee's dish was interesting. The mushroom-truffle part was tasty, but the ribbon pasta tasted like something from Hamburger Helper. I know they make it in house, but the pasta was not what I was expecting. For dessert, we tried the pistachio cheese cake and caramel chocolate cake. The dishes were respectable but nothing to elevate it from the crowd.

US58bu07t65NUGjVwB2s8A.text: Tried it for restsurant weej. Mushroomstuffed ravioli were amazing! The pasta trio annd chocolate ravioli were underwhelming. I have eaten better at olive garden. I also did not appreciate the stench of fish as you walk in. Good service though. overall just not worth the price

JUeE7ohusfgZmobIG2Rn5g.text: good Italian place... the menu has some unique things and they do a good job... it is pretty expensive but for specials occasions it is good.  Zac is right about the accents... but it adds to the flavor and the pesto butter is pretty good as well...

nVFXeXwM2GfyKc9P34Wu-g.text: It is a cute little restaurant, has a nice wine list.  I ordered the Linguine with clam Sauce, and a glass of pino.  Personally i think the food is actually pretty good, nice northern italian.  But the service was just ok.

P8lPgaee-Imx5Y9M8SvU7g.text: Me and my wife had dinner at tomas's this friday night.  My wife found Tomaso's Restaurant  in the internet, and since it was by our hotel, we decided to dine there. To our surprise, the  restaurant had a great atmosphere and really authentic  Italian dishes. Even though we arrived quiet late at the restaurant, the staff made us feel very welcome. The waitress provided us with incredible attention and service, with a super friendly approach. She basically helped us decide what would best please our craving for italian cuisine. We are both looking forward to our next visit to arizona and of course to Tomaso's since its italian dishes as well as  service are exceptional.

pvA9UclayQKOX1LW1YvCVg.text: My boyfriend happened to extend his layover in Phoenix overnight and we were hungry from traveling from Oakland that afternoon. We wanted something good to eat and fast food was not going to cut it.  On his first visit here he met a guy who recommended a few places to eat and this was one of them. Wow, great food.  We were under dressed and looking haggard, so we ordered takeout. We had some sides, I know broccoli was one of them for sure and bread was included with the meal. I had the best veal ravioli in a delicious, tasty sauce. Very light, with tomatoes, sage, garlic, onions and possibly veal broth and olive oil and butter. My cleaned off my plate. My bf ordered fettuccine with grilled chicken. Serving size on that was amazing, he didn't finish it all that night, and guess what I had for lunch and dinner the next day, so good even reheated. I would have loved to go again and try the beef carpaccio. Highly recommend it!

mF2wRJKMK26kx4YLY4kIBw.text: My husband & I made reservations for two for an anniversary. When we got to the restaurant they told us the restaurant was sold out to a Xmas party and proceeded to walk us out to their pizza place. They put us at a table in the middle of the doorway. I could not get into my seat it was so tight. I tried to pull the table out . That put my husband way in the middle of the doorway. They did have an open table for 4 but would not make it available to us. We just left the place. Ruined our evening!!!!!!

SW_hmWoy5es9yGZhbsE-1w.text: This review has to do with a group function, specifically a holiday party for my company. I have personally planned holiday parties for the past 16 years. I have never been in a situation where my wishes for two drink coupons per guest was not honored. My company has been willing to purchase two alcoholic beverages per person and any other drinks ordered are from a cash bar purchased by the guest. This restaurant had bottles of wine free flowing without a drink coupon. They actually took over how the alcoholic beverages were dispersed. One waiter even told a staff member, "don't worry about it, your company is paying ". Unfortunately, it was a family member not someone that felt like that was a positive thing.  Very poor management of my contract and wishes for 40 people.

MhDlMXariwxFhHDrLvOonQ.text: First time review: GREAT place! Our server was Italian, and the food was True Italian (reminded us of our trip to Italy last year). It is a bit pricey, but the food is definitely worth it!   Second time review: Decent service, although some of our orders took a while to come. Calamari appetizer was large and very good. The beet salad was delicious! Both of our meals were good, but they were a bit too creamy.

HNCP_WeabgUW3slj41JStg.text: Love the ambiance and the fact that even the waiter speaks Italian.  cant be as authentic as that.

Zf3F9frusx7vOJDLKpuIWw.text: We tried Tomaso's for the first time on our Anniversary. Disappointing. For the cost, I expected it to be over the top! The service was great, but the food was nothing to write home about. Won't be going back.

VqEWdp96ZvDrjiuIvA1oGg.text: Perfezione! This little restaurant is the epitome of fine Italian dining!  There's nothing more genuine than Tomaso's. We called this restaurant when they were scheduled to close in a half hour, but when we expressed how excited we were to enjoy a meal there the manager agreed to stay open until we had finished.   Upon arrival the door was held open and we were warmly greeted and seated amongst a few other late night diners who were finishing up. The waiter had just finished rowing his gondola from Venice, his accent thick like a finely formulated Bolognese sauce. He delivered the fine red wine we ordered like a master sommelier and took our requests for appetizers patiently. La vita bella!  After we sampled four of their finest appetizers (which were all prepared to perfection), we decided it was time to move into the main course. There were many different dishes ordered: seafood diablo pasta, grilled fish, steak, lobster tail, shrimp, lamb, sea scallops! Everything was cooked with an excellence that could only be matched by the almighty himself. I enjoyed the Tuscan Mixed Grill, which itself was one of the greatest dishes I've ever had. I did, in the tradition of Italian family-style dining, HAVE to try a little bit of everything though...  Topped off with a little dessert dessert wine, this meal could not have been served or prepared better. Tomaso's is a great place to go if you want to get the best Italian food possible.

VGV3mICydYlAX2eNm2QHLA.text: Excellent Italian.  I would strongly suggest Tomaso's to anyone looking for authentic Italian in Phoenix.  This place is in the Biltmore area in the same strip mall (strip mall in Phoenix? Shocking!) as Sportsman and Tarbell's which leads to my only complaint--parking.  There is a free valet (tip them you cheapskates) so that problem is partially mitigated.  This place is a real throw back. The waiters are all pro's and have thick Italian accents.  The garlic butter offered with bread is out of this world so even though it's green and strange looking, enjoy it.  I was craving simple spaghetti and meatballs--it's not on the menu but they'll do it for you if you ask nicely.  Coupled with a few Morettis (decent Italian beer) it was a great experience. One place I recommend with confidence and will return to at the earliest opportunity.

SN0M5mOxEAnbZn8OLxEDCA.text: Love this place! AMAZING food, so friendly and helpful with lovely, quite ambiance.

fEBTKRgEzMKYaULSknhS5g.text: The food was the best Italian my wife and I have had since we left the Bay Area. All of the waiters speak Italian. The menu has quite the variety. Tonight we ate there for our anniversary. They treated us a little more special than usual!  Make sure you make a reservation like we did. The place filed up quick!

ZoZoypQ-2OQ9Lq3ezGA2Iw.text: I have to say I was disappointed.  I was hoping for some fresh, tasty homemade pasta and instead found a menu full of heavy meals (lots of meatballs, lobster and steak).  And it was much more than I was expecting to spend - all together $50+ for a glass of wine, a salad, and pasta.    I should have known when I pulled up to the place, which looked like a closed-up men's club.  I think I was one of the few women in the place and certainly the youngest person in the room.  Most tables seemed full of older couples and older men doing power dinners.  I think I confused the wait staff, walking in by myself (I was in Phoenix on a business trip and craving pasta).  I scanned the menu, hoping for something light and fresh...which was a no go.  I ended up ordering a special, black linguine with seafood.  The linguine itself (and the sauce) was actually pretty tasty.  However the amount of seafood was overwhelming and I had to dig out the pasta.  The salad was okay - a Caesar served in a parmesan shell, which was a nice touch.  Overall,  I would give Tomaso's 2.5 stars.  The service was great (although my waiter seemed unsure what to do with a single woman at his table) but the food was only so-so for the amount of money I spent.  Like I said, disappointing.

2NckdEl1xh0pVJlo6mUR_Q.text: My husband and I had dinner at Thomaso's. We got seated promptly and was given a basket of bread. It was boring, not very tasty bread...but I thought "that's authentic, in Italy the bread is not great either." It came with a flavored butter that was pretty good. The waiter forgot to bring the oil until much later in the meal. The service was good in this place and really fast. I think it was the quickest meal I have ever had. We started out with the calamari. It was very bland and could have used one more minute in the fryer but the marinara sauce that came with it was great! The salad bianco was really good. The dressing was super lemony. I loved it. My main dish was ok. I got the special which was homemade penne ala vodka with langastino shrimp. It was ok. It didn't rock my world. The sauce was a bit bland, the pasta wasn't al dente  but overall the experience was good. My husband loved his linguini with clams!

LsMRFCXHdJW702X2QcZZow.text: The food and service were good except the house salad didn't have much going for it. It didn't much of anything but lettuce and the oil based dressing was flavorless.

IrZG_EM-HEsKkmNASSEdLA.text: I am not a big fan of Italian food that's not homemade, but I must say I love the food here. Seafood is always excellent! Also, my family hosted my grad school graduation dinner here for a party of 12 and the service was out of this world!!! They took such good care of us that I will always have fond memories of that night!!! It's not cheap, but the quality is well worth it. Parking is limited, but valet is complimentary.

8NIvsthXtowIdZVhccWhkA.text: Food was excellent, service great, good wine list, but way too large a markup on the wine.

c83N3iL93zfG2jEREgCA7w.text: I've been dining at Tomaso's for many years and have yet to have a bad experience! As a matter of fact, my wife and I have have brought many friendsand family with us to enjoy our favorite Italian restaurant and we have yet to find anyone who found the food or the service to be anything less than spectacular!    If you are looking for exquisite, authentic Italian food with the utmost in service, Tomaso's is the place.   Chuck & Lee

bldpMiIWK2yEEgOaA_NQTw.text: Here for Valentine's Day dinner, the place was packed. Had a short wait at the bar, they mix a mean Manhattan (with Maker's Mark as the well bourbon). Got seated, wait staff was attentive and professional. Courses were paced perfectly. Had the stuffed clams, 2 large shells perfectly prepared. Lobster bisque with nice chunks of lobstery goodness. Shrimp-lobster-langostino fra diavolo in a tomato-seafood stock base over perfectly al dente linguini. Had a bite or two of my dates pear salad, that was awesome, too. This place isn't cheap, but the experience and food are well worth it. I wish more restaurants around the Valley had their commitment to the service side of dining.....

v_SdF3u69kwwBJ0TSmxzoA.text: i was having a thoroughly unimpressive trip to phoenix.  actually my 1st trip to phoenix ever and was starting to feel extremely disillusioned.  i had always heard great things about how fun phoenix was but i guess i must not have been listening very carefully b/c on the way there and while there everyone i spoke to had unkind things to say about the dinning and nightlife.  (turns out tempe and scottsdale are the place to be.)  anyway - excuse my rant. the point is that tomaso's was my one gleaming ray of hope for a decent meal.  i found it on yelp and based on user reviews (w/ the help of gps) i trekked across th 10 E and wah-la! there it was in a nevada bob's strip mall. - ok not impressive but when i strolled in at the off-peak the bartender (Dave) greeted me and promptly set me up at the bar. he doubles as the sommelier and was really helpful in picking out a perfect glass of wine.  the food (linguine w/ clams) was good but not stellar. the linguine was a bit over cooked but it was still better than anything else i'd come across.  the most impressive thing here is how friendly the staff and the patrons were.  it's clear that tomaso (the man, the myth, the legend) has cultivated a good following of locals that come back again and again.  i was surprised to find that he also owns three restaurants in california, a winery and i believe another restaurant in the phoenix area. - you would never know it was such a big operation b/c it still feels small and authentic.

Yjj1PZM-cSUjupQ76KPuEw.text: Great uncomplicated Italian food.  Reminds you of bit of stepping back in time to the "Rat Pack" era.  I have been able to find some Sicilian dishes here I have not been able to find elsewhere.  Service has always been fantastic and have loved whatever I have ordered.

oDjGd1OzQENjPhV_l2HkvQ.text: I went there for a friends Bday and it did not disappoint.  Our waiter lived in Italy for 10 years and was a great server.  The pasta is very good and the drinks are strong, I recommend both.

4E-s-pCWjWsMH7dM2toKmQ.text: Tomaso's is a good, down home, northern italian. They make their own pastas fresh daily, and you can never go wrong there. A friend of mine ordered a steak there once, and claimed it to be the dryest piece of meat they had ever eaten. Meanwhile, I was working on my $28 kobe ravioli, which consisted of 4, count them 4 raviolis... yeah, definitely not gonna cut it. The service is ok, but there are issues now and then with small irrelevent things. They have a very old clientele from the area that I just get the feeling have been frequenting the restaurant for a very long time, and wont dare change what they order. That being said, they don't want anything to change from the menu to the ambiance, to the staff that works there. The whole staff is Italian, and they know how to cook pretty well, but I can't shake that feeling that I'm about 40 years too young to be there, and the portions are just way too small.  +1 for great wine list +1 for homemade pasta -1 for the old people atmosphere.

-6A_C18ev2iIeV1v461o1w.text: Didn't expect much here upon arrival to the strip mall it is located in but was pleasantly surprised.   Decided to go for Italian food rather than go to the trendy Tarbell's  located in the same strip mall. As opposed to other reviewers,  I simple just parked in the half empty lot in front of the place, no problems.  Valet was available but not required.  The place was empty but the reception was friendly and the service was good to excellent.  Friendly Italian waiter told me it was the slowest week of the year traditionally here.   The wine list was more than adequate but the Italian selections were pricey, I found some better deals on the US selections.   The food was also good to excellent with excellent pastas and fish available, I had the cioppino (I know cioppino and this was 4 star). Salad and vegetable sides were done very well. It is a little old school, kind of reminded me of a suburban Italian Durant's.

n12bzy-uAs43XQPVVPQULg.text: Fantastic Italian food. Service is personal and friendly. High on the price factor, but it is what it is. Honestly, it's a place to go for specially made authentic Itialn food.  If you want cheap, go to the Olive Garden.

Suip6OM1PYzv1KciCT_Iqw.text: Who knew they had their own winery?! One of the best cabs I have ever had. To start they bring you bread with rosemary butter. That butter lathered on the bread is amazing! Do not miss that. We shared the chicken Parmesan and the short rib ravioli. That chicken breast was super tender and was a thick chicken breast. It had not been pounded thin.This is the best Italian I've had in the valley in over 10 years. And trust me we have tried many Italian restaurants, especially having a brother-in-law from Italy. Even he agreed! Ended with the cannoli. Do not skip dessert. Be sure to save room!

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sO-ixnQ4MmBnm2AuYK3-6Q.text: Had dinner at Tomaso's for the first time and everything was excellent. I had the chicken parm and cheese tortellini and it was wonderful. The cheese tortellini was perfectly al dente. The zucchini and caprese appetizer was equally as good. To end the meal we had the tiramisu was so good. You never know what you can get with tiramisu but it was the real deal. Gino was a fantastic host to boot. I highly recommended stopping by. Tomaso's will not disappoint!

1kUyv_-aVGxzGOFKSPna9w.text: 5/7/19 - I wish I could grant this establishment more stars but we had such a terrible experience tonight.  I know this may not affect anyone's desire to visit this restaurant as it seems to be a very busy place with a good number of regulars.  We happened to be on that side of town and I looked on their website and saw they had Happy Hour until 6:30.  When we arrived, we verified with the staff at the host stand if happy hour was still in effect and she said it was at the bar.  We sat down at the bar which was empty at the time.  The bartender approached and I asked if he had the happy hour menu.  He said happy hour was over at 6.  He showed us a menu and pointed at the time.  I told him the hours on the website were different and he just shrugged his shoulders and said it was 6.  He then left us to tend to the service bar.  I'll just say, he was very unfriendly from the get go.  I pulled up the website on my phone just to be certain I did not make a mistake and when he finally came back to us after serving up a few drinks at the service bar, I showed him the website.  Again, he just said happy hour was over at 6.  I asked if he could honor the happy hour because of the website and the fact that we came there for that reason.   He said no because the kitchen would not allow it because it was getting busy; he pointed to the direction of the dining area.  I do not like to do this, but I asked if he could see if the manager would honor it since it was a discrepancy on the website. He shrugged his shoulders again and went to get the manager.  The manager turned out to be the person who greeted us a the door when we first walked in and told us that happy hour was still in effect.  She, of course, honored the happy hour price for us.  She was very professional and polite and came around to ask if everything was okay when we ordered food.  The bartender continued to be very unfriendly to us and he never asked if everything was okay.  We felt very uncomfortable during the entire experience and we did not dare order another drink as we seemed to be a bother to him.  Other patrons sat around us at the bar and he was very friendly and attentive to them.      Additionally, as my dinner guest finished her wine, there was a huge sludge of sediment at the bottom of her glass.  We tried to get his attention but he went about tending to other duties and we did not feel like sticking around.  In hindsight, I should have taken a photo and we understand that wine will do that, but still , it was just salt on the wound. After we left, I called the restaurant to get the bartender's name, but I think he answered.  When he answered the phone, it was hard to understand his greeting.  I apologized that I had the wrong number and he just hung up ... again, very unfriendly.  It had been ages since I dined at Tomaso's and my guest had never been there.  With plenty of other great authentic Italian restaurants, this is one we will not make an effort to return.  I understand this was just happy hour, but this one was certainly not happy by any stretch.

TuUzg5M-jC1DoY12MC0Q3Q.text: The greatest Italian restaurant in AZ bar none. Don't go for the hype anywhere else Tomaso makes everything himself. REAL Italian food!!

AzW_VCtD6-7SEESd6dwfjA.text: First time here at Tomaso's. On first impression, over the phone making the reservation mind you, Gino was friendly and made us feel at home right away. His personality was warm and welcoming. Upon arrival, the happy feeling continued, as he greeted us by name and personally walked us back to the perfect table for our party, which included our 3 year old. Our server Aaron took over and proceeded with the impressive service and recommended the perfect dishes and right amount of food for us to be completely full and take no leftovers, as we have someplace to go after. The veal and filet mignon bolognese and the lemon veal scaloppine were amazing and we will definitely come back to try the rest of the delicious looking menu.

mJwVDamxN-aNbcZRkddRhQ.text: My boyfriend and I dined on Thursday 2/28 for our anniversary. We were extremely underwhelmed and it was very disappointing.  The evening started ok, except we didn't get menus when we were sat. The host had them then walked away. She didn't even say, "ok I'll be right back with better menus" or something.... So, after we waited a couple minutes, my boyfriend got up and the other host said, wow give us a minute*jokingly* but it wasn't funny, we knew what she meant. But sitting without menus we couldn't even get started. Then everything slowly went down hill. Our waiter brought me a sample of wine that he thought I would like. It was good and I ordered a bottle. It was opened when he got to the table and he said he just opened it to get the sample. Shouldn't that be a "by the glass" bottle (because it was offered by the glass as well) and then do a proper wine service at the table? He poured generous, which is fine, but when I went to pour another glass, the bottle was empty! The waiter did not come and top our wine off at all, so it was literally just the initial 2 glasses poured, so was that even a full bottle? 2 glasses and it's empty? We'll never know since the bottle was opened before it got to the table.   The kitchen clearly crashed. 45-50 minutes for the scallop appetizer, which was ok. Another 45-50 minutes, at least, for dinner. I could see guests around me getting frustrated as well. I think we were told 5 times, "Your food will be right out, just a couple more minutes." Our waiter brought us 2 glasses of wine on the house for our food taking so long. Or was it the 2 glasses we didn't get with our bottle? Who knows. The food was good. I liked mine more than my boyfriend liked his. He thought his food was way over cooked. Not great for having to wait as long as we did.  Our waiter was hard to find towards the end, so my boyfriend put his card on the table. He ran his card and when he returned it there was no itemized receipt. As someone in the industry, that made me so mad!  As a whole, the experience did not compete with my expectations. It was a very upsetting anniversary dinner.

cS183rkh6YSNEQ3NcwXpNQ.text: Went to Tomaso's for the first and last time tonight. We sat at the bar and had the worst service ever. The bartender Anthony ignored us the entire time, never refilled our water or offered us another glass of wine. The appetizer came out lukewarm then it took forever to get our dinner which was also not hot. The chicken parmigiana was ok but the raviolis seemed undercooked. We wanted to try a cannoli but after the poor service we closed out our check and went elsewhere for dessert. Very disappointing!!!

rb2wY0REJojWeHLigTL8IA.text: I posted a review shortly after Valentine's Day about my experience with Tomaso's on Camelback on Valentine's Day, but apparently posted it under the other Tomaso's, so it was removed. Our experience was very bad, poor service, rubbery lobster, etc. Melissa, listed as owner of Tomaso's, was very gracious and offered to make it right with a gift card.   I private messaged her my address. She said she sent the card-that was over a month ago and no further follow-up from Melissa and no card. Thank you for nothing, Tomaso's-you have ensured that neither me or ANY ifmy friends (and hopefully people who read this post, will ever go to either Tomaso's again!  I have to amend my review somewhat--Melissa really came through and sent me a very generous gift card and was very persistent checking with me to see when I got it and sincerely trying to make amends. I will definitely give Tomaso's another try and truly appreciate their efforts to please!

jy17CZhBBOTNzsuFnIegEA.text: I really enjoy the atmosphere here. Bartenders and servers are great, I love the calamari. The parking sucks though.

KUFRP5V7QThL2VV7CIP0MQ.text: We went there tonight for the 1st time. I have passed it for years and once I tried going for a weekend lunch, but they are only open for dinner on weekends. Since it was part of Arizona Restaurant Week, I was reminded to finally try it.  In summary, the food was solidly good, the service was impeccable, and the ambiance was quiet but not stuffy.   I had the stuffed zucchini flower for the appetizer and it was perfectly fried and very tasty. The sole piccata was flaky tender and had just the right amount of caper sauce. I was also pleased that the vegetables were not over cooked. The tiramisu was light and had a good amount of cocoa powder but wasn't too heavy.   I definitely recommend Tomaso's for fancier events -- it is not chasing trends but just providing a great service-oriented product that has allowed it to be in business for 41 years.

gpCysL_FukQ3UU43MX-GqA.text: Don't bother, unless you have a TON of time to waste with nothing else to do.  A group of 6 of us and it took 4 hours to eat (drinks and entrees).   The food:  Good. It's a solid 3.5 stars out of 5.   The service: -5 stars, based on a 0-5 star scale!  The service was OBSCENELY slow. We had a reservation and was seated promptly. The wait staff basically ignored us beyond that. It took TWO HOURS for us to get food. It was busy as it was a Saturday night but it wasn't so busy that a wait such as this should be tolerated.   We will never be back.  After reading several other reviews, the POOR and SLOW service seems to be a trend. Melissa seems to respond to all of these with the same state of shock and surprise. I see her email address is part of the Maggiore group. I see this means we also need to avoid Hash and the Sicilian Butcher. As a piece of advice, when running multiple restaurants as part of a group with your namesake-- fix a problem when you get MULTIPLE REPEAT reviews all saying the same thing!

62gjVO9mwTfLl9Af5bG6Yw.text: The food and service was fantastic!  Unique, delicious Italian dishes and a great wine list.   The atmosphere was authentic and we felt like part of the family!

QYUvCT4ZbAYpJfFqpd82Ag.text: Tomaso's is a family favorite !!!  We have celebrated many special occasions with Tomaso's and our recent visit was exceptional.  The entire staff was outstanding and the food is fabulous.  The portions are generous and we always feel like we are very well taken care of.  We were dining with our young children and the staff was engaging and made them feel like royalty.  My boys LOVED that our server folded up their napkins when they went to the bathroom, just like they do for the adults.  Sometimes the simplest acts of kindness make all the difference in the world.  Thank you Tomaso's !!!

wU8OBJTlri3fyY5IZpB2CA.text: Let me start by saying I grew up just outside New Haven, CT. For those that are connoisseurs of Italian food, you know that with the possible exception of New York City, there is simply no better place in the country for Italian in terms of volume of choices and quality of food. Demographically, CT has one of the highest percentages of Italians in the country (18%... second only to Rhode Island) Wooster St. in New Haven is a must. (tripadvisor.com/Attracti...) With all that said, Tomaso's rivals the quality of food and service that I would get at Wooster St. The Veal Saltimbocca is my "main stay" and the wine list features the best of Italian wine imports. The portion sizes are perfect, enough to fill you but not overwhelming. If you get one of the desserts (which would be the only thing that is not top-notch on the menu)you will leave full. The service is excellent... all of the servers have been there for many years and know the menu inside and out. The are excellent with new people unfamiliar with Italian food or wine pairings. Lets be honest... Arizona is a desert in more ways than one... it has to have the worst ethnic food in the country with the exception of Mexican. It is filled with Chain Food that people have convinced themselves is good. Olive Garden, China King, Carrabas etc. etc. I have not been to an Italian restaurant, or any restaurant, for that matter in AZ that even comes close to this place.

7UvdZcSBDgBaXLuWGkfrqg.text: Great food. Possibly the best veal I've ever had. I did not rate it a 1 because of the food or service, that was phenomenal. I rated it a 1 because I was charged an additional amount on my card then what my bill actually was. This is a sneaky trick waiters do to see if they can get away with getting extra tips with hopes you will not check your bank statement, will not want the hassle of disputing with your bank, or not recall the amount charged and accept it for what it is.  This is dishonest and unacceptable; dishonesty is never the way to go. The service was exceptional up to being charged an additional $30 dollars after already including a 25% tip. Our total bill was 196, we left 50 in cash in the bill sleeve. 196 x 25% = 49. We were not a large party, there were only three of us, so an added gratuity would not be assessed. After putting zero on the credit card slip, and writing cash near tip on the receipt. I was then days later charged an additional 30 dollars. That is an 80 dollar tip for a dishonest waiter; albeit the service was great it was not worth almost 50 percent. I loved the food and family feel but will not be going back due to the business practices. I understand you are in the business of making money, but not at the "added" expense of the customer. It's not the money, it's the principle.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veal osso buco with saffron risotto (14oz Veal Chop, Grilled or Milanese)

x5LydI0jgzAZmTQqPupmbg.text: Absolutely delicious! The raviolis are so delicious! Such a wonderful unexpected find for us!

T0_U0bzbzLiYvzR77jY1pQ.text: I'm Italian. This place is Italian. Everything was top notch. We will be back. Aaron was a great server and Eduardo took great care of us.

wkbwcMhQ8WocTqIKvlgIzg.text: We just moved to the Phoenix area and stopped by for dinner impromptu. Great service and ambiance. Grilled chicken breast was cooked to perfection!  Highly recommend, we will be back!

ILLcSvmmE_gdzYvFlWfo5Q.text: We left still hungry, very sad.   TLDR; not the best, go to Sicilian Butcher instead.   We walked in and was seated promptly. Our server was ok, nothing spectacular. I ordered the clam linguine and my husband got the veal and filet rigatoni. The sauce for the rigatoni tasted canned, we were so disappointed.   At least the Chianti was good!

hoR47g9HYgSibzHAJju-ng.text: We were very disappointed in the experience tonight. We felt lied to and cheated and embarrassed in the way we were treated. All is forgiven but no way to treat a customer! I won't be back. I am a business owner  and I would want to know this, I am going out of my way to give valuable feedback so I post this as a courtesy.

WMwu2wvkEwAfleCFjpfI9Q.text: This place is totally underrated.  I would give this place a 4.5    I come here every time I visit Phoenix for work and it does not disappoint.  I've had their ribeye steak, their osso bucco ravioli, and their cioppino and they are all excellent.  My favorite of the three being the cioppino which I ask for a little spicy, sans the noodles.  A big plate of the seafood & tomato broth and some crusty bread is all I need.  Tomaso is still the head chef of this place and is always trying out new dishes.  The best ones make it onto their printed specials list in their menu.  The last night I ate there, he had just flown in from Italy and still went to work testing dishes.  Lots of respect for hard-workers like that.

Gf8TixR0mbtHZ0MzvfoTrQ.text: The lunch we had at Tomaso's was so amazing that I had to write about it!  This was my first experience at Tomaso's so I did not know what to expect.  I have always heard great things about Tomaso's but had no idea it would be this good!   We started off the meal with a shrimp appetizer - the shrimp was sauteed in a lemon caper butter sauce and tasted so good.   Then we ordered our lunch entree -  rigatoni Amatrciana and veal parmiggiano.  The pasta was cooked to perfection, sauce was amazing and the veal was so tender it practically melted in my mouth.  We even decided to splurge on dessert - a wild berry tart which was light and delicious - perfect with an espresso.  If this is what lunch is like at Tomaso's, I can hardly wait to check it out for dinner!  Definitely my new favorite Italian restaurant!  Tomaso's is perfect for a business lunch and I know it will be the perfect date night dinner spot.  The wait staff in the restaurant was very attentive to our needs and made sure we were well taken care of without being overbearing.   Tomaso even came out and introduced himself and asked how everything was which has never happened to me before. I can't wait to come back - very highly recommended!
