KlOtv0JP_-qTjMpmB1cEJQ.text: Tomaso Maggiore, Has run Tomaso's for 35 years, since 1977,  this well know (voted best Italian Phoenix yearly) restaurant on the Camelback corridor has the goods.  You can find great Tuscan or Sicilian wines. The food is fantastic. During our meal this evening with a AZ Restaurant week pri fix menu we had the Burrata & Dates as well as the Pasta Pillows drown in a sage butter sauce. For the Entree we had the Sweet potato gnocchi and stuffed veal. Dessert we had the tiramisu and chocolate crunch cake. The food was perfectly cooked. Often gnocchi can be over cooked, gluten chewy. Ours was perfect.  The veal was stuffed with cheese, accompanied with a mushroom demi glaze which was so awesome.  All was delicious! Our bottle of wine with dinner was the Super Sicilian Luxus 5. Tomaso, On one of his many trips to Sicily, he met by chance Giovanni Maggio, who shared the same dream. In 1994 in Agrigento Sicily, a vineyard of 150 acres was born featuring wines with the bold, natural flavors of the land, and a complexity that ensured its success. Maggiore's Luxus 5 Meritage is a blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Nero D'avola, 13% Merlot, 5% Petit Verdot and 7% Syrah.  A dry, medium intensity. The flavors are quite complex and include red cherries, red plums, vanilla, black pepper, clove and liquorice. The service was great, it pays to have employees with longevity who are dedicated to the task. Here are some facts from Tomaso's web site that makes you appreciate him even more: Tomaso's opened its doors on September 10, 1977 at 3:59PM Tomaso's has served over 10 million locals & visitors over the past 35 years Hundreds of thousands of Arizona residents have celebrated their birthdays, anniversaries, first dates and even weddings at Tomaso's. Tomaso's has supported 100s of local non-profits, schools and charities. Year after year, Tomaso's has been voted the Best Italian Restaurant in Arizona. Over the past 35 years, Tomaso's has provided employment for 1000s of Arizonans.  Many of our past team members have gone on to become successful  restauranteurs, lawyers, doctors, business and community leaders. At Tomaso's, the best is yet to come!

dYVYvOwfCzvYVK0xQpGJwA.text: The last time I was at Tomaso's was 19 years ago for high school prom.  I've been excited to go for the last year and I was super disappointed. I ordered the King Salmon and it was fishy and overdone. The waiter was snobby when I tried to order a Moscow mule and they didn't have ginger beer.  I also felt pressured to order appetizers and desert when I wasn't hungry enough to want those. Go to North if you're looking for great Italian good and great service.

pb31ZtL8acjVRECEJSISNw.text: Absolutely LOVE this place! Went for dinner last night with the girlfriend, a friend and her mom. The appetizer we wanted was no longer on the menu, as Tomaso likes to change the menu regularly, but we asked for it anyway and our request was happily granted. We ordered a bottle of Tomaso's own red wine, Luxur 2004, fabulous! Our appetizer was lemon caper shrimp. Filet mignon was perfection, and for dessert we had fudge truffles. I asked for strawberries with the truffles and again, wish granted with zero hesitation. Everything was perfect as always. I wouldn't bring a girl here on a first date cuz it's a bit spendy for a girl that has no guarantee, but the place definitely drops panties.

Y1KMTt_4A5V8VvtDdDDMgQ.text: Had another exceptional evening at Tomaso's last night. Been here many times. Great quality food, great service. Best Italian food in Phoenix.

FTIV2cQum4Qvj0zupykH4A.text: We enjoyed our Spring Training dinner at Tomaso's very much. the food was excellent and the service was great also, Generous portions and I loved the Parmesan Salad shell it was awesome. We will be back on our next Spring Training trip.

M86Dpsea36gzW_8hqc326g.text: This was our first visit.  Being that our visit was on V-day the menu was a special holiday menu and the items I had read about on Yelp were not all included.  We were walked through the entire restaurant into their sister restaurant. We were told there were so many reservations they had to open up the other restaurant. They sat our party of 4 at a small hi top bar table. They said that's all they had.  During our entire meal they kept trying to sit people at these hi tops and people kept complaining.    Our service was good and the food was good.  We had the linguini seafood which was good, but lacked that flavor.  Another person had the filet ravioli. It tasted like a meat sauce on top of the ravioli, but was good. The two others had the eggplant. My wife liked it and thought it was delicious.    Overall I would say good food, but I would probably not make a trip from Gilbert again.

Pt3hIAJWQp5sBHvnOTPGCw.text: I wanted to take my boyfriend out to a nice Italian restaurant for his birthday rather than doing a steakhouse. I got a recommendation from a coworker to try Tomaso's and I was excited to try a new Italian restaurant that wasn't Olive Garden.  The parking lot was small and we had no choice but to do the complimentary valet.  I'm not a big fan of valeting my car because I've had things stolen from my car before and then I feel obligated to tip.  The atmosphere inside is really nice and cozy and has a romantic feel to it.  The menu items sounded amazing but I was actually pretty disappointed when we got our meal.  Before going out to dinner, I had scoped out the menu online and decided on what I wanted to eat which was the "scampi and risotto".  The description of this dish was "Grilled Giant Prawns with Garlic Scented EVOO; Served with Seafood Medley Risotto" and I was expecting giant prawns and what I got were 4 little prawns with risotto that wasn't cooked all the way and the rice was hard and dry.  I was really disappointed and I really wanted to like the food but it just wasn't what I expected at all, especially for a high priced dish.  The bread and butter they give you before your meal was delicious.  The bread was warm and fresh and the butter was good.  My boyfriend ordered Sea Scallops, Blue Lump Crab, Scampi & Nero di Seppia all'Arrabbiata and he said it was ok but the sauce seemed bland but the seafood seemed to be a generous amount.  The service I will say was exceptional.  They filled our waters and was very attentive.  When I made the reservations to the restaurant, I noted that it was my boyfriends birthday and during dinner, the owner came by and wished him a happy birthday.  When we finished our meal, without even asking the server, the manager and three other servers came with a piece of cake and lit candle and sang him happy birthday.  It was great to see that their service was on point but as far as their food, it's nothing to rave about. I probably won't be back anytime soon.

6beAlSHUulp3fsk862_sZw.text: Amazing food.  Three of us went there for a celebration.  They did not have the mouth watering filet mignon on the menu but they were willing to give us anything we wanted.  So I ordered a medley to different things so I could try out different menu items.  The salad was very good with the pistachos.  The bread and butter was even a wow factor.  The place was very nicely lit and amazing wait staff.  Geno waited on us amazing they way he spoke to us, he treated us like royalty.  The tables had white linen cloths on them, very upscale establishment and not at all noisy you were able to have a conversation without yelling.  We ordered the wild caught pistachio salmon which was very good, the seafood pasta with sea bass amazing and the trio of fist size raviolli's  The butternut squash homemade raviolli was amazing.  Very nice atmosphere, great wait staff, nice ambience everything you would want in a upscale restaurant.  Plus the melt in your mouth Filet is always an added advantage!!! Yum Yum Good!!!!

mugAbpx5OXe6YG0SjolEMg.text: Went on Wednesday place is nice service was good but didn't feel like we got good value for what we paid.  Can't give 3.5 stars definitely not 4 so have to give 3.  Will try again and when I'm off lent.  I had a seafood pasta dish the server recommended.

VCr6bbj-celqpXqj412VoQ.text: Just visited Tomaso's for the first time, and regret that I hadn't dined there sooner!  The tiny parking lot has free valet parking which made entry and exit very easy. Yes, my party tipped -it was hot outside!  My party arrived at 5:30, which is early, and there were just a few tables seated. As our meal progressed, the place filled to capacity and we dined on a weeknight.  We were greeted at the door with genuine warmth by several employees and were quickly taken to a table by our server. Our server was very warm, patient and gracious. Other servers kept our drinks filled and plates removed quickly and efficiently. Every need was filled immediately.  The herb butter and fresh bread were perfect. The bread was warm, chewy inside and crispy outside.  The salad with pears and gorgonzola was served in a baked parmesean bowl and featured slices of fresh bartlett pears, gorgonzola cheese, candied nuts and a house made vinaigrette. It was crisp and delicious, with a nice contrast of tart, sweet, nutty and cheesy.  The hazelnut risotto was delicious, as was the past trio. Please note that the pasta and risotto dishes are modest in size, and designed to be one course in a meal. These are not huge heaping plates. They are artful servings of great handcrafted food. Traditionally, one spends a lot of time at an Italian meal, so, courses are reasonably sized.  The pasta trio was just right for my mother who is a senior citizen and eats modest portions. She had a salad and the pasta and was very happy.  The Osso Bucco was delicious! The portion was very large and I wound up sharing partly because it was so good, but, also because it was a big plate of food. It was served in a sauce with chunky vegetables and plated on mushroom risotto.  We enjoyed the house Chianti and it was a perfect complement to the meal. Coffees were fresh and very good. We did not have dessert because we were stuffed!  Overall, this was a very solidly great dining experience; a perfect example of the best Italian fine dining.

5iZ36go0Ep8PtGtw4xj4VA.text: Great service! Okay food! Had not been there in a while! Either the food used to better I have just become more of a foodie!  Its not that its bad food. Its okay for me. Its is authentic Italian with fresh pastas etc. but my husband makes his own pasta so I am spoiled.

r-EtwZ2En7LMx3R4IrvmiA.text: We were here last night and I had the "fresh petrale sole and lobster ravioli."  The lobster ravioli was good but the "pan-seared, parmesan-crusted, lemon and butter" petrale sole was overpowered by lemon. I was able to find part of the fish without the "lemon and butter" but it tasted bland and watering. This pricy dish was a disappointment.

n0bfuArxf0ytcuDviXaY3Q.text: I have never left a review and got this app just to leave one today - this place is TERRIBLE!!! We went there last night for a special night's dinner; my husband had the Alaskan Halibut with Lobster Ravioli and I had the Alaskan Halibut with Blue Crab over Squid Ink Pasta: the halibut was over cooked and dry for both dishes, the blue crab tasted like it was from a can, and the sauce for my dish tasted like it was from a jar. The squid ink pasta was under cooked, less than al dente. They served regular tap water. The server was distracted, inattentive, and never checked to see how we enjoyed the meal. The temperature of the restaurant was too low, myself and other guests were freezing.  Two things that were good: the lobster ravioli were excellent and the manager tried to adjust the temperature. Needless to say, we were more than a little disappointed! We expected more from a restaurant that charges these kinds of prices! Keep your money, go somewhere else, this place isn't worth it!!  We probably should have tried Tarbells in the same strip mall.

4GZo9ffx8dlN5XnB0_-lTA.text: We were looking for some good Italian food, so we decided to visit Tomaso's. The entire experience was unsatisfactory. You have to park in an awkward lot arranged so that you have to turn out and then back in before you find the Valet. Our waiter vacillated between hovering at the hostess station while staring at us to ignoring us completely. The salad turned out to be canned pears atop wilted lettuce with an odd topping of fried onion strings. The pasta was good, but not worth the $20 asking price. The dessert and coffee were served with no spoons, so we were forced to go foraging for extra silverware at a neighboring empty table. Finally, we had to wait at least five minutes at the valet station for the attendant to arrive back from his break.   On a Saturday night the restaurant was more than half empty, so the waiter really had no excuse. Luckily, his counterpart who was serving the next table over took pity on us and refilled our bread basket and water glasses, offered us fresh ground pepper for our appetizer, and  answered our questions about the dishes our own waiter had abruptly plunked down in front of us before bolting back to the hostess station.   While the experience here gave us a lot to laugh about, we will not be returning to Tomaso's.

s7uASMU6S5YbSprcHBUUPQ.text: This is a classic Italian restaurant landmark in Phoenix.  The atmosphere on the entire experience is romantic... just the way an Italian restaurant should be.   The service was exceptional and I deeply wanted to give this place five stars.   However, there was a blimpish on my last visit and I just can't get over it.  So, I ordered salmon in an Italian restaurant... and I should have ordered pasta or something traditional.   The dish was called Lobster crusted salmon and should have been called salmon with blobs of lobster sauce...  there was nothing crusted about the dish and seemed to be a bust for $32.   Anyway, I'll get over it and I'm sure I'll be back.

L_B_t0Yq3EeFbu7ZNQRbiQ.text: All vacationers should deffinitely eat at this restaurant. I had not eaten there for over 20 years.  Came to Phoenix to see a ballgame and had to see if the restaurant was as I remembered. It was absolutely wonderful. Pesto buter and bread left you wanting more.  Eggplant with stuffed gnocci was great.  Eggplant was not smothered in cheese so you could actually taste the dish.  My husband had the pasta special.  It was tender and tasty with a light cream sauce. We also had a tossed salad and tiramisu. Very relaxed and have to come back sooner than 20 years.

RlR41jsRJ4mA1NenexID4A.text: I had high hopes for this restaurant as I was directed to it by my friend and fellow Yelper, Donald S., and oh...my...God...was the squash ravioli at Tomasos AWESOME!  It was perfect.  It arrived quickly, was presented well, was a good portion for lunch, and geezuz, the sauce was to die for!  It was a bit expensive for lunch, but those of you who know me, know that I say that at almost every meal.  I'm cheap, what can I say?  Oh, I forgot the bread!  It was perfectly baked and came with the most wonderful herb butter.  For bread lovers, this will be on the top of your list!  I highly recommend this restaurant, and I can't wait to try it for dinner!

q2AYf6RNWgadHr_477mMhQ.text: Finally authentic Sicilian food in Phoenix. Combine it with great service and it is a classic go to restaurant.  If you haven't been to Tomaso's what are you waiting for!

yWcQaCv24hRk2-aq5fDTpg.text: Visited this location for the first time on Monday. A girlfriend and I sat at the bar and started with cocktails. Sal the new bartender there is awesome. I had met him at the other location in North Scottsdale. His service is always outstanding, We tried the bruschetta and meatballs on the happy hour menu and both were delicious, We are definitely going to come back with our partners for dinner to try the full menu, especially the pasta.  If you haven't tried this place the bar is very cool and inviting and it's a beautiful restaurant in a very convenient location on Camelback..  So glad to have found this place and thanks Sal for making this a great night out with my friend Amy visiting from Chicago.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiramisu was delish!

h7s1n_0UCD5oMclIe0r-vQ.text: The service had tonight was the lowest level I have experienced. Our waiter ignored our table, stopped by once to tell us he had a 10 top and 6 top he was trying to take care of and then could help us. Asked to switch waiters which took us a other 20 minutes to put our order in. After an hour and fifteen minute wait to put our order when, we we're finally able to do so. Interestingly, tables around us were being attended to.   Tomaso's response was to offer a dessert of which two people at our table could not even enjoy due to dietary restrictions.   I've never had a worse experience.  Update: At no point has anyone apologized for this experience. We've been here for two hours and the haunting paintings on the wall are a pretty great depiction of our evening.

TR_gTxwCrQvE1d0Zj4K3Jw.text: Superb, inventive & fresh Italian food served with love and care by a fantastic staff. From the moment you walk in the door until the time you waddle out, stuffed to the gills, you are reseated as family.   Visited with my family and had the best meal of the week. Started with fried calamari and carpaccio. Both were perfection. Main courses included a lamb shank, prawns & fettuccine, seafood gnocchi and a knock-out mushroom & corn busiati dish. The sauce on the busiati was the richest mushroom flavor I've ever tasted.  All the dishes were cooked with love.   The manhattans were stand-out drinks.   Get yourself here post haste for a lovely evening.

TxosJD5UEvevIu7LLdeJVA.text: While in the Phoenix / Scottsdale area recently, we finally decided to try Tomaso's.  We had passed it often traveling back and forth on Camelback in the Biltmore area. I was in the mood for a nice Italian meal and was not disappointed.  This establishment has an old-school look and feel - in a very classy way. It provides for a formal, upscale experience (despite casual attar being perfectly acceptable).   The wait-staff was personable, professional and extremely helpful. We started with wine. Our selection was a Cabernet Sauvignon  - Frog's Leap from Napa Valley. As always, absolutely delicious.  Then we enjoyed carpaccio, czar salad and a bone-in veal parmigiana. The carpaccio consisted of tasty and tender, thinly sliced beef tenderloin accompanied by arugula, capers and parmigiana shavings. The czar salad was supplemented by a parmigiano basket that added just the right flavor and crunch. The veal portion was enormous ... a meal in and of itself which was backed up with asparagus and potatoes.  This meal, while not inexpensive ...... was memorable. I shall return.

NIhbinsi-Rz_g8FsxK0L2Q.text: This place is so Cassy,From the Beautiful paintings on the wall to the Beautiful oversized Bathroom Mirror for a selfie or two. The food is delicious, I'm still thinking about how my lobster bisque melted in my mouth leaving me to want more even after I finished the last drop..I was also fortunate enough to enjoy one of the last pieces of Lasagna (it was the very end of the night) YUMMY!!! The staff is Great , extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the different dishes... I will be back with an even bigger smile.. Thank you for a Great dinner experience..

-Z92Y8suQBrq2rOtxWf2vQ.text: Excellent service and very good food.  I have never been disappointed.  Reservations suggested, but they seem to always make room.

2aWHB60m5gLn8Fu6o6M1CQ.text: We were referred at the Waldorf Bitmore to come here.  Excellent!  The atmosphere is elegant but also casual enough if you want to wear shorts.  Service was outstanding. We felt very pampered.  The food was about the best Italian we've had. My husband is picky and loved the lasagna. It was the best we've had.  They also make their own wine that is more affordable ($56 for a bottle) that was very good.  Price is what to expect for a nice Italian place.  Family of 4 we had appetizers, unlimited bread, 4 dinners, 2 desserts and a bottle of wine for $212.  We will definitely be back!

F9vSTtY942e1rEe1pAy-GA.text: Veni. Vidi. Amavi. We came. We saw. We loved. Tomaso's is one of Phoenix's hidden Italian gems. I often forget it is here and when I return, it is like a passionate romance with carbs. Next to my old gym and another great restaurant, it is a historic spot that continues to charm.   Service is spectacular and I could not gush enough about their staff. Apparently, the bottles of wine we drank also made me forget my server's name. He was uh-mazing and spoiled my girlfriends and I when we came to celebrate my home purchase. It's quaint, yet sophisticated enough for your discerning palate. The bar is intimate and welcoming if you rather sit alone or meet some wonderful patrons. While we wanted to start off with cocktails, we ended up ordering bottles of their unique wine the Monte Olimpo Cabernet Sauvignon/Nero D' Avola. If you want to be transported to Italy, you have to partake in the vino correct?!! As I have said before, a glass of wine is a lie. You know you will drink the whole bottle, or two or more in our case. I highly recommend it as it paired really well with everything on the menu my little appetite could devour.   My favorite dish is the Michaelangelo and befittingly so named as this dish was a beautiful marriage of veal, beef and carbs. If you can't get enough, ask for more bread and slather that rosemary butter for an extra kick of goodness. I am especially appreciative that Tomaso's was accommodating to my vegan friend. Naturally, we finished with several desserts such as the tiramisu. The Angel Kiss is a lover's kiss on your lips. Trust me, it will leave you wanting more. Occasionally, they have wine dinner nights where you can sample their specialties with wine pairings. I encourage you to come, sip awhile and dine often to enjoy Sicily here in the valley.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mangia bene. Ridi spesso. Ama molto. Eat well. Laugh often. Love much. Who doesn&#39;t with the classic tiramisu?!
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian style: Pasta. Dessert. Vino. Oh, side of delish bread too.
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. First we eat dessert. Then we do everything else. You can&#39;t resist the angel kiss.

uF2D6mrMCK8UiHqmu4npOQ.text: Excellent service, food quality and presentation.  Our waiter was patient and explained every dish perfectly.  Bus boy was on point, water glasses were never below half. This is the place for Italian in the biltmore.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ravioli and veal roulade
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Caramelized Chocolate Souffle
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sole dinner

TEeblFQ3-OLqXgj8BIZqzg.text: Legit Italian in AZ (take it from a former Philly boy)!    I had been meaning to try Tomaso's for a while, and Restaurant Week provided the perfect opportunity. Since I was flying solo, I sat at the bar. Anthony the bartender was very attentive, made a killer Manhattan and also gave me a great wine recommendation. The veal roulade with ravioli was outstanding. I'm really looking forward to returning for some of the other menu items that sound equally mouth-watering.   But in addition to the food being great, I was really impressed with how Anthony and Gino made me feel at home - treatment that you might expect a regular to receive, but I was a first-timer! So I really appreciated the friendliness and the great customer service!   Grazie, Tomaso's!!! See you again soon!

KtDVqfDSDCGPXhVN71klAg.text: Wanted some good authentic Italian meal and this did the job! Everything we had was delicious with the exception of the lobster bisque- too salty. Couldn't even finish it, both the waiter and manager checked on us and I shared everything was great with the exception of the soup- they both said sorry and continued about their evening. Charged us for both lobster soups seeing clearly we didn't even finish one.

dikBPF8UeLM58BUJJT25JQ.text: It's ok Italian so if your near by check it out but their are a lot of better options a short drive away     Enjoy.

OJbIm3756V15Vj4Doz4ogg.text: I took my Dad, his SO, and my bro for Father's Day. The food and service were excellent. But double-check your bill. We were charged for a dish $8.00 more than what was ordered and received. Specifically, we, ordered and received  veal medallions ($34), but charged for veal chop caprese ($42).  (I "prepaid" by slipping my CC to the server so Pops wouldn't get the bill. I didn't peruse carefully our charges til I got home. My bad. Still doesn't excuse the bad bill.).   For a place with the rep of Tomaso's, I'm really disappointed.

lBUykXO6yP_yzkCCoNHChw.text: Really good food, the parking and the valet situation is absolutely infuriating and out of control, we tried to beat that arriving earlier but they do not follow the opening times they set at google, saying open at 4:30 pm, right at 5 pm door was still locked and was a cluster  getting our 3 friends together at a new place on the last minute, its a shame not going back because the food is quite amazing, better and better thru the years and i was a customer since the late 90s.

fcVjJ_MPBVQBO9EIMISCpg.text: This is my favorite True Italian Restaurant in Phoenix. I love this place. Service is top notch, food is excellent and the ambiance is second to none. The atmosphere is classy yet comfortable with an amazing attention to detail. You need to stop by and have an outstanding meal. We had Aaron as our server and he was amazing. Geno greeted us and was very welcoming and friendly. I can't say enough good things and will be returning very soon.

jjnRzBrjVryfutL2JPMC9A.text: Went there last night for Valentine's Day.  I am thinking the tip off to it not being good is the fact we could get reservations when I called the evening prior.   I asked for a 6:30 reservation, and I was given the options of 6:15 or 6:45.   I picked the 6:45, got there early, and we didn't have to wait.  In fact, there were empty tables. ...  Oscar was our server.   Nice guy.  Professional.  The thing I saw that was a bit disturbing is the fact that when he opened a bottle of wine at a table close to us, the top of the foil fell to the floor.   He kicked it under the table.   Huhhh??  Is that what servers do?    Also, another table next to us had a folded napkin under one of the legs.   I would imagine to keep it from wobbling.  I would think, if they are going to do that how about a less conspicuous color since it readily stood out.  On to my meal.   I ordered the house salad.   I was thinking I should have ordered the dressing on the side.   I mean, it wasn't bad but there was so much that it made me cough -- maybe cause of the vinegar? -- and was completely saturated!  I think I was having salad in my dressing. ...   My table mate had the caesar's salad.   I am thinking I should have ordered that.  I ordered their Silver Oak cab, which is a 2013.   Not a bad bottle of wine.   I looked it up at Total Wine to see what the markup is.  Not bad.  A nice heavy body wine.  We perused the menu.   He decided to get the RIGATONI WITH VEAL & FILET MIGNON BOLOGNESE and I got their special, which I think is similar to the LINGUINE AMALFITANI.   It had all kinds of shell fish: shrimp, lobster, clams, mussels.  I can't remember what else.  I tasted his.   He didn't particularly care for it and neither did I.   It sort of looked like a bad version of spaghetti with meat sauce, and the taste was, well, interesting. ...   I thought not at all palatable.   And I mean it.  My dish, I think had the same sauce.   I concentrated on eating the shell fish.  The shrimp was tough as was the lobster.  Cooked a bit too long??  Thankfully, it didn't have much of the sauce.  He is Sicilian; therefore, I asked if he would return.   He said no.  He would like to give them the benefit of the doubt and say maybe they were busier than normal cause of it being Valentine's Day.   Uhmmmm.   No.

tSpePMSQytj8H5XohHGtVQ.text: Absolutely LOVE this restaurant! Food is excellent! Service great even when Tommy is away in Florida doing a restaurant makeover!

grWgxLNn8RbZdJUn4XfrYw.text: Great classic Italian with excellent service! Every dish was fantastic and they have a great wine menu also. Do not skip dessert!

ChEVMPI3ZfDo_TguR0TGlw.text: My family and I are in Phoenix for vacation and were lucky enough to have dinner at Tomaso's! Tom, Anthony,  Aaron and Gino were absolutely lovely, professional and very passionate about not only the amazing entrees but also about their guests. They surprised my daughter and husband with birthday desserts that were  unexpected and delicious. I would say that tonight's meal is definitely one of the best I have ever experienced! I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone in the Phoenix area.

-cZhnCjr89uEsnHP1srpBw.text: Food was good but service was not nearly worth the price tag of the place. We had to go find our waiter though there were waiters and bussers a plenty buzzing around. Though our table sat down first, we were the last of the three tables that our waiter visited. Even when he was finally at our table, he was clearly not appreciative that we wanted to put in our drink and appetizer order. We asked him to please put the order in as we were starving. He still did not and I watched him walk around the restaurant chatting with tables. When the appetizers were finally brought, he'd forgotten the pear salad. After I said something, he apologized and put in the order for the pear salad. We asked for some olive oil to have with the bread and he brought red pepper and another condiment and said he couldn't find the olive oil. Eventually he found it and brought it over. The food was quite good. Later, he brought out an espresso in a giant cup. The busser remade it for my husband and put it in an espresso cup. When my brother asked the waiter for an espresso too - he was also given his tiny espresso in a giant cup. The busser was great btw - super attentive regarding the waters and bread and dishes. With the espressos, the waiter brought a broken glass container with the sugars, etc.. We had to search again for our  waiter to get the bill. Food was good but service was way off for the $300+ bill for a party of 4. There was live music.

WADjFF9gZ8WpYgiMSYan-w.text: Amazing food! They make you feel like your part of the family. The pastas are like your grandparents used to make. Always a stop when visiting Arizona! Such a gem in Phoenix!

PzKDuvL_7InUwcuHu9cUTA.text: Our family dined at Tomaso's last night, Christmas Day. We have dined there and their fabulous restaurant next door, Tommy V's for years and years. We did not have a good experience last night. The four of us were placed at a table for 2. We waited 10-15 minutes before anyone came to offer us water, drinks, bread or a menu. Our waiter was rude. He barely had time to talk about the menu or offer his suggestions. We had to ask for bread and additional drinks. The wrong soup was delivered. When the second bowl arrived it was cold. Our entrees were not hot and the fish did not smell fresh.When our entrees were served, we had to ask if they could remove the 1st course plates. When we finally had to ask for the bill, the waiter shook his head in disgust.  We heard that this was the first year Tomaso's was open on Christmas day. I don't think they were prepared for the volume of business, but I would think the number of reservations would be an indication. They have been in business long enough to know. The owner was hanging in the lobby the entire evening and never looked around at the tables to see if anything was needed. Needless to say, it was NOT a good experience.

WQ1mIiFLroNfIN-h8szeiQ.text: What a wonderful experience! Gino, our waiter, was extremely helpful and knowledgable about the menu! We were glad to have him as our server. The food was outstanding and our cream puff dessert was a home run! We will be going back soon!!

GA0bdAWpFXGevmiqSTwBgg.text: Dined at Tomaso's with a group of 12 last Friday evening while enjoying the Labor Day weekend at the Bilmore. We chose Tomaso's due the the Yelp reviews and proximity to the hotel.  Although our waiter was not Italian (I believe he was South American), he was pretty good.  I think he tried to give our large group time to chat so it was nice not to be rushed (which seemed very European).  The meals served were beautiful, but I don't think any of us thought the food was that amazing (we also ate at the Capital Grille and Frank & Albert's-see those reviews-and really enjoyed the food).  I thought the restaurant had priced its menu well for the ambiance and plates served.  I would not be opposed to returning, but there are other better options in the area.

VaRIUE5wwT3EBCsHyQOE8w.text: Such a great restaurant. Food was beyond amazing. It was nice to meet other Italians and talk about our beautiful county.  Buonissimo! Grazie mille e ci vediamo in Sicilia!

4srgatRUO1EGmhSS1KEWdQ.text: Yesterday was my birthday and ended up getting out of work late so we called Tomaso's to see if they could seat us because they closed at 10 and we would get there at 9:20. They politely told us to come on by. The host was so friendly and had the best sense of humor. He joked around with us but remained professional. Our server was awesome. He was friendly and didn't seem agitated that we got there later than we would have liked to. He served us in a timely manner and gave us just the right amount of space. I had the chicken parmigiana. It was the best I have ever had. Toward the end of the night they were cleaning off tables for closing but they assured us to take our time and that there was no rush. I really appreciated that. My dining buddy had to use the rest room so I waited and spoke to the bartender who recommended dishes to try the next time we came in. It was an all-around awesome experience and the staff was not only friendly and personable but they made us feel at ease even though I felt so bad about coming in close to their closing time. I would recommend them to all my friends.

ptFkppjXlul1fBjLBitH1g.text: We like this place. Because we don't live nearby we dine here once or twice a year.   We enjoyed lunch today. I love the linguine vongole.  We will be back. I was a little frustrated by wine price: we had a nice wine for $49 but I recognized it as a $26 wine at an Italian restaurant near our Oregon home. Of course this was white tablecloths and wonderful service so I suppose  high priced wine supports it

Ucb9uE6piyrnTb9wlwff9A.text: We've been dining at Tomaso's before we even officially moved to this area five years ago. Over the years, they have never disappointed. They go above and beyond to make us feel special. They are one of the few places in town willing to cater to you, even creating special dishes. I want give a huge thank you to the kitchen, Robin and entire staff for going above and beyond on our to go order Tuesday evening. They specially made several dishes for us. They even made my favorite gnocchi, which I hadn't had in a couple years. Spinach ricotta stuffed gnocchi in a Truffle pistachio sauce, I could eat that dish everyday. The veal chop was excellent, as well as the Veal Parm. The trio of ravioli and lobster ravioli were outstanding. We really enjoyed the delicious surf and turf creation. Desserts were excellent as always. Thank you so much, we absolutely adore this place!!!

eOS0HKmMGHWFvJusrS790Q.text: This is my favorite place to eat in Arizona and I'm a native. I've been here almost 32 years and I just love coming here.  I came here once with my wife and then several months later with some coworkers. I had the same waiter (great guy with the pony tail) and he remembered what my wife had ordered months back. I couldn't believe it.   The bar is top notch. They make the best Manhattan in the valley.  This is real Italian food folks. Of course there are some negative reviews because well, some people just like The Olive Garden. You can't please everyone. If you like going to The Olive Garden, this place isn't for you. If you like to feel like you just discovered a gem in Sicily for the first time, definitely come to Tomaso's.  It's nice enough to celebrate Valentine's Day or an Anniversary here, but also cool enough to go with a group of guys to get some drinks and eat for a few hours ... Yes, you can literally spend hours here eating and drinking. They always make you feel like family.   Jason

r7F15TzyulwpfAwQJI6DUw.text: Standard fare.  I didn't see the costs, so I can't speak to that.  Service was excellent.  Pasta was slightly undercooked, bolognaise was a little bland.  Salad was inedible.  I would come back, but I wouldn't get too excited about it.  If and when I come back, I'll update my take on other dishes.

Li6jDEYEyi4-Myq0deOBCQ.text: Outstanding food and service, Giovanni was our waiter and was phenomenally well versed in the menu and its various options.  The only complaint that my party and I had was the Valet was a little rude and vague about parking, It's definitely easier if you enter the lot from N 32nd St. rather than East Camelback to avoid the loop around the lot to the valet personnel.

frucjm4ZQ3ZHnUJgRHxtSw.text: One of the finest Italian restaurants in Phoenix.  The service is excellent, the atmosphere is classy, and the food is outstanding.  I brought my father here when he was in town, (he's a third generation Italian) and he was also impressed.

ybxM0J_PQgsBJTspdvXVsQ.text: We had an excellent meal at Tomaso's.  Nice atmosphere and pleasant waiter.  We had a "light meal".... Caeser salad followed by pasta (carbonara and special) and great Tuscan wine.   We avoided the valets and found a space in the parking lot.

agxRC4KQnd4liG4-jGFw5Q.text: A rehearsal dinner I went to was hosted here this past weekend - I have to say overall I was impressed with the place. Italian food in the middle of the desert seemed like a questionable choice to me, but I remained with an open mind, open and mostly dehydrated...  The party of 30(+/-?) arrived with a fairly good clip, there were a few stragglers, and a few people who were there before the main group of us. We were all graciously welcomed and directed to the back/function room.   The waiters were (THANKFULLY) quick to replenish all of our water glasses as soon as we emptied them, and since we are from a way different climate, we went through a TON of water even before everybody else had arrived.   I had forgotten to mention in my rsvp that I had a nut allergy, and when I looked at the place setting and noted the included menu had an almond dessert the waiter was very good to work with me and get me something that I could eat - three flavors of gelato, very tasty.   The pasta dish was fusilli carbonara, which is one of my favorite dishes (to make at home, and to order) and they did pretty well with it, I have to say, I've seen some places mess it up royally, but this had a good balance and when I got some extra grated cheese from our waiter, it gave it a little bit more of a "bite" or "kick" that it was looking for to really fill out the flavor. If it had been homemade fusilli, Tomaso would have won my heart!  There was some confusion or miscommunication between the waiters, us about wither or not wine was *part* of the meal, or if it was by the glass, and added to a tab for our table. Regardless, it was good wine, and I'm glad I had it for my meal, it was a small price (confusion, and in dollars) to have a nice glass of wine to compliment my chicken, and everybody else's steak.   The service was excellent, they catered to our every need, and assisted even the more bizarre requests. The one thing that could make this private function room THAT much more functional, in my mind is a bathroom that is closer than the polar opposite side of the restaurant.   If I ever find myself back in this part of the world, I'll try to make it back and try some of their other dishes - and hopefully be better prepared for the heat!

0rmCwtdWsLJSFGHa7vydkg.text: Absolutely delicious! This is not "Americanized Italian" food. The pasta dishes are far from ordinary & full of flavor. The Fava Bean Salad was incredible, it's a seasonal food item, but a must have! The service was great with professional/friendly staff. The restaurant is great for a romantic night out, business dinner, or for casually chilling at the bar. I am bringing my family here the next time they come to visit.

028lzfSaZmatukKNncM_pA.text: Saturday night I had the pleasure to dine at Tomaso's with some friends. I hadn't been there in years as we live in Chandler and don't often venture that far. It was worth the drive. The restaurant reminds me of old Hollywood- kind of glamorous and classy. The waiters are dressed in crisp white shirts with ties. Our waiter was very Italian and very gracious. Nicely set tables, great ambiance, and great art on the walls. We ordered several different things and please forgive my spelling of some of these dishes. If you look at their menu you'll be able to figure it out. I had the lobster bisque, 2 had the minestrone soup and one had a beautiful salad- all were excellent. The Asso bucco (sp?), eggplant Parmesan and lasagne were all first rate. I had a noodle dish with prosciutto that was fabulous. We had tiramisu and a nonna cake thing that were amazing- especially the tiramisu. A little spendy- probably someplace for celebrations- but great value, service and food.

XAezTaQqfQQSANpGpb5X3w.text: Arrived earlier than our reservations and were seated by 645, didnt get our food until 830 and our order was screwed up. When we addressed the manager he insulted what we ordered and was incredibly rude. I was this close to calling my local godfather to ask for a favor. Maybe if the food was better I would have even slightly understood, but it was nothing to scream about and we were treated more than poorly. Would give a 0/5 if possible.

KmK-hqwlklK-5xMUfKoY2A.text: Poor service, the waiter made me feel like I was stupid every time he came to the table. Food was honestly not my favorite. We tried salad, soup, 2 entrees, and 2 deserts and nothing was worth the high price we paid. There are better places in Phoenix for Italian food.

ySFYDPjIUUJNNsqCtV2ohg.text: We have been going to Tomaso's for at least 15 years. ALWAYS a special treat! We go for. 99% of our anniversaries, birthdays, and special evenings out. The staff is very attentive and the food is always amazing! Best seafood in town and the pastas are better! Get a bottle of Monte Olimpo Nero d'Avola or Wedell Pinot Noir, you will love them both!!

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Had this bottle for dinner! Best Pinot Noir I have ever had by Wedell Cellars!

plqaPphrQOWmBDmPDthZEA.text: Best dinner I've had in a long time! I was there with my family and family friends for Mother's Day and Tomaso's had a superb special Mother's Day menu. Our family friends are from Italy and say it is authentic as you can get. The quality of food was excellent, and I was especially impressed by the Petrale sole main dish I ordered. Having worked in the seafood industry, I am a self-proclaimed fish snob, and was blown away by the quality and preparation of this fish dish. Tomaso's gets his seafood from Santa Monica Seafoods, who has a high-level reputation for quality and sustainability.   Wait staff was fun to talk with, some are Italian themselves, and I truly felt like I was back in Italy!

MS4PhsD7vQjUQaTOW3j1ag.text: Really amazing Italian food. This is one of my must-go-to spots every time I'm in Phoenix. Ambiance, service & location are great. Valet parking out front is convenient.  They always hit the pastas & meat dishes way out of the park!

CtCLBVUuWntIs2Bwm36xow.text: I went to Tomaso's as my 1st Restaurant Week stop. The service was absolutely great! I sat at the bar with a great bartender, Robin. He was knowledgeable and very excited about food, just like me.  When I mentioned I needed to skip dessert, he was happy to substitute and Italian wedding soup! That was very generous! It had no pasta, which is unusual for a wedding soup. Instead, diced white meat chicken took its place next to traditional and delicious little meatballs.  I came specifically for the zucchini blossoms, and they didn't disappoint! Beautiful, tasty, even the stems! Though I think they could have used a bit more salt. And after all that, I forgot to take their photo!  The shrimp on the shrimp and lobster ravioli was amazing!! Very meaty, no fishy flavor whatsoever, and the lemon sauce was perfect! The ravioli had a clear clean lobster flavor and perfect tooth bite.  #eatARW

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Shrimp with lobster ravioli
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Italian wedding soup with no pasta but white meat chicken
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Crusty bread with herb butter

01V30gL8aHkW8QA5d58QIA.text: This was my absolute first time at Tomaso's. What an experience!  From the moment I walked in I was greeted very pleasantly by the hostess and three staff members.   Staff were extremely knowledgeable of the wines as well as the menu items. Some spoke very heavy Italian...I don't; but it didn't pose a problem. After my arrival, the place filled quickly; ranging from couples to eight member parties. Noise was at a minimal.  I began my dining experience by having a glass of resieling as I admired  the artwork, lighting, furniture, etc. and soaked up my surroundings. I noticed that every occupied table had a bottle of wine on it... except mine.  Meal options: I chose to start with the Fiori di Zucca - stuffed zucchini blossom with organic ricotta, basil & mozzarella. Talk about a treat for your palate! For an entree, I chose the Menage a Trois -  lobster, scallops, and shrimp in a savory fresh tomato sauce, olives & basil; served on linguine. Yum. Yum!  Everything was on point and served in a timely fashion.  I was please with the entire experience. I recommend Tomaso's for special occasions or for those that missing True authentic Italian food.

UH1R5jxxEcMifW-_dWyIww.text: We just went to Tomaso's on Valentine's Day and I will tell you their food there is to die for! I had the scallops and lobster pasta with red sauce and it was delicious. I had not had lobster that I have liked since we went on our trip to the Breakers and that was a 5 star restaurant and you are walking away with a $600 bill. Tomaso's was very reasonably priced and their food was 5 stars! I will definitely be back

U6eL_d6ZCuKG2d47aGA4Hg.text: Great food ... upscale experience! We were here for lunch, and I was happy to find vegetarian options on the menu. The service was good too! Definitely going back.

w8uF6axpPx_54lQCi9SqfA.text: Love this place!!  Food is wonderful,  and good portions.  We always pick this restaurant when we want a nice relaxing dinner.

cabZBLkeDI0hxzmoWcJefg.text: Sadly, I did not find this place to be as tasty as I hoped or for the prices either.    However, I thought it was going to be uber good because of menu choices and descriptions...and the prices.  But prices lie sometimes...or a lot!  Oh and perhaps because their pesto butter that they give with their bread basket was yuuuuuuuuuumy!    We went for a friend's birthday dinner and so we shared the fried mozarella balls with anchovy sauce and capers.  Now that was tasty!    I got the filet mignon ravioli with veal demi sauce, aromatic vegetables, truffle, and parmaggiano.  Sigh.  The raviolis were good, but I was expecting parmaggiano melted on top and more of a taste variety.  The first few bites were tasty, but I quickly became bored with it.  I did nosh on my friend's seafood ravioli (which were pretty good since it had a cream sauce) and a bit of another friend's veal.  I've had mouth-watering melt-in-your-mouth veal in Sorrento, Italy...so that is what I was hoping for and expecting.  Not so much. See my attached photo...there certainly isn't much to it, very 2-dimensional.    This one was a definitely let down for sure.  And for the pricetag, I'm not happy to not have enjoyed it more.  There seems to be a very old crowd here as well.    Our server was very friendly and helpful as well.  I was afraid not to finish off my last ravioli though, even though I was full, because he would give us a hard time if we didn't finish things on our plate.  Gotta love Europeans!  I remember that happening often when I traveled all over Europe awhile back.  LOL

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Filet mignon ravioli

SqkeS-O5I9hX97zB_0a6lg.text: We went to Tomaso's last week for a special meal for my daughter who was starting cancer treatment. They treated her like royalty and we had a delicious meal. Tomaso himself cooked her favorite pasta and gave us delicious strawberries with cannoli cream for dessert. It was an awesome experience and the entire staff went out of their way to make our dining experience memorable and fantastic.

xk-E3kHkQBFgxrJZ3AL9nQ.text: I am baffled by some of the not so stellar reviews that Tomaso's received. Aside from the ambience (love love LOVE that there are no televisions), the service was impeccable. As a first time patron, I had no idea what to expect, and in truth, I have very high expectations (my dad owned upscale Italian restaurants).  Of the five items my husband and I ordered, two were prepared specially for me (oh my, the gnocchi with meat sauce was pure heaven). Our server was knowledgeable, courteous, and funny. We had such a pleasant experience. My only regrets are that I did not ask our server's name and I didn't leave room for dessert!

r2Jf2AX6bizS-QbKj-nCKQ.text: Hands down best Italian food in Phoenix/Scottsdale! Authentic, great quality food. The service is top notch. Many of the wait staff are Italian and have an accent which is nice because it gives the feeling of a truly authentic experience. The gnocchi is unbelievable as well as the veal and chicken. I've never had a bad meal here!

J-nl4CVK1U_8jVyWHfP_JQ.text: Not anniversary friendly  Food was good was expecting for it to be outrageously delicious when to celebrate an anniversary for some friends when making the reservations I mentioned it was an anniversary thay never mentioned anniversary to them or brought them and anniversary cake. We did get dessert the tiramisu is freshly made every day everything else is store bought so I highly recommend the tiramisu good

UDOLoxU_CM-Ox0GOeGC5ug.text: Excellent meal tonight at Tomaso's in Phoenix AZ.  Menu contains descriptions of one mouthwatering selection after another. Impeccable service combined with a homey setting. Readily understandable why the restaurant has been around since 1977. What a treat from start to finish. Did I mention the best vodka martini I've had in weeks?

CXvQOqyzP0VP0hkQY9Yc1A.text: Last minute for lunch, in the area, we were seated immediately. Beautiful establishment. Peaceful, quiet. Not so busy for lunch. Staff seems distant, to be expected, I guess. Today we had Mozzarella Tasting Caprese, artistic presentation, tastes average. The Italian Wedding Soup is disappointing ~ bland & needs more meatballs (I'm really not a big eater either). But I can share with you the "silver lining" to this dreary day: The House Made Sicilian Sausage ~ The most flavorful sausage served with a sauteed mixture of bell peppers, onions & pine nuts all in this wonderful, hearty, robust glaze!!! It's definitely going to be the reason I'll go back - maybe for take out.

QF7DMcRMuqhozOryRCb2EQ.text: Always wanted to try the food here since it's come so highly recommended. Did not disappoint.  Felt like being in Italy with the great atmosphere and the staff.  Will go back many times.

ytBRdwKK-lmPE9N-0ZQD_Q.text: Very very pricey.  Food was ok. But portions are small. The chicken parmigian was ok, but ridiculously small for $30.  Doesn't even come with pasta. Who serves chicken Park with vegetables. Not sure how you get away with charging those prices but I guess their model is to get them to come once/pay once and not get many returning customers.

0tq4Y9mD3RpPPPN3IPXzJw.text: First visit here with an Open Table reso for 5:15 PM on the Friday of Valentines weekend (Had ballet tickets for 7:30). We were disappointed with the choice made by the hostess to seat us at the last two top by the rear door. Worst table in the resto. We were entertained by the staff hanging in the service alcove by our table grumbling lol. Our waiter was clearly not their best. We observed other waiters who were polished pro's and wished we were enjoying their service. Cocktails were generous, wines by the glass, so so.  The Capresi appetizer is terrific with Heirloom Tomatoes that were very tasty. I had the veal chop saltimboca and it was terrific, if too much food. My partner had the lobster and seafood pasta and it was very very good. All in all I would say there are other choices that I would make before a return visit, and if I return I will insist on a central table and a better waiter.

b-b5QFggFVluvWVgyknOdQ.text: FANTASTIC!  For Thanksgiving.  Gino was great, made great recommendations and the Tomaso red wine was wonderful.    The clam appetizer was De BOMB according to my teenagers. We had the Italian sampler, Butternut squash and Eggplant  , Chicken Parmesan, Lobster scampi ravioli and Squid Ink pasta with a Special Tomasso prepared desert platter.  A meal to remember!  GRAZZI!  The staff was amazing and attentive.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The remnants of a special desert platter. WONDERFUL!!!
Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mr.  Tomasso and my husband Roger

-w15KdwG3NuvBwxzYL25pw.text: I'm so disappointed with the service here. We made a reservation through Yelp for 8pm last night, and when we got there the hostess promptly seated us. However, the room they sat us in was extremely cold, and I'm a baby when it comes to cold, so my boyfriend went back to the hostess to ask if we could get another table. She told him we'd have to wait 10-15 minutes, which we were fine with, so we headed to the bar to sit and wait.  About 30 seconds later, the hostess came back and said she had another table for us. We thought this was awesome since we were expecting to have to wait. What we soon realized is that she just wanted to get us a table quick so she could have better tables for other guests. So she proceeds to walk us to our table... And sits us at literally the worst table in the entire restaurant. It's the kind of table that you wonder why they even bothered to put it there because the location is comically horrible.  To my direct right was the kitchen. I could literally see into the door. And every time a server went in or out all I could hear was the severe loudness of the kitchen.  About 5 feet behind me was the busser station. And if you're unfamiliar with a busser station, it's where the bussers put all the trash and dirty dishes after cleaning their tables.  I can't believe this is where you would seat people in general, let alone people who made a reservation! The pasta dishes are an average of $20 per plate, so there's no way I'm going to pay around $150 for a meal for two people when I can practically reach out and touch the kitchen garbage behind me! We ended up leaving and didn't even order food, and the hostess didn't even say anything to us when she saw us leaving. Talk about a terrible experience and some really bad customer service.  We will not be back.

Ect2Es96iwQ1avvFlfAkfA.text: Great location for large groups. We had The Sicilian dinner and it was amazing from start to finish. Great service and Great food! I will always recommend it to anyone with a large group or romantic night out!

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

joa9bWEoCcTt_SWfnOAshw.text: I was there for a group dinner. I thought it was really strange that they didn't have take-out boxes and we couldn't order a soda. They also didn't ask me how I wanted my steak cooked.  The seafood dinner looked good and the bread was great.  The desserts were a little lackluster, but I think this would be a great place to go for a date night with the husband. But you should be prepared to pay a steep price.

ACaPycN3PdcLyKvuUEWSlA.text: Came last night for the first time. Beware that parking at tomaso's can be a bit tough with tarbell's sharing the same lot. It wasn't bad with valet, just had to wait in a line 10 minutes.   Got immediately seated and given water and our server came by a couple times so we ordered our drinks but it took a little bit of time to figure out what we wanted to eat - anyway, server sort of disappeared... First before we ordered, then our food took forever! Like it was over an hour after we came in that we finally ate what we ordered. We did get some bread though, so that helped.   Our server was weird, one girl in our party said she wasn't sure what type of wine to get and he just said ok and walked away, no help. She also was still eating bread with delicious pasta sauce and he tried to take her plate away.   The food was really good, I got the ravioli pasta combo and it tasted great, small portion but I wasn't necessarily expecting Olive Garden. And I sort of feel like if we knew what to order at the start, the food and everything would've been faster but I don't know, four stars because the service just didn't really try and it took so long and I was so hungry!

wTzVraogTaDu_dxw9-Ixjw.text: This is one of the best restaurants in Arizona. It's a cozy neighborhood joint with world class food. I've been to Tomaso's numerous times and I always kick myself for not going more often.  Last time I was there I went with my father. And, like always, as I was looking over the menu I couldn't believe how low some of the prices were for the quality of the food I knew they had. We started with the Fillet Mignon Carpaccio, with I could've eaten ten of. We ordered the Osso Bucco for the main course, which was $22. It was out of this world! It literally falls off the bone it's so tender - to the point I was wondering how they got it on the plate without it falling apart.   Everything was wonderful. The only knock I really had was the price of our after dinner Limoncello's. Our Negroni's during the meal were the typical $10 which is perfectly normal. But when we got the 1.25 oz Limoncello's they were $10 a piece as well. A price I was taken back by but perfectly willing to pay for the quality of the meal we had.   I highly suggest you check out this world class gem! Tomaso has been there every time I've dined there, and even though I'm not a regular, he always stops by to talk and ask how things are. A very nice man. This place will continue to be my suggestion for when people ask me where to get good Italian food. It's also one of the best "date night" restaurants I've ever seen - very romantic.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Osso Bucco.... One of the best meals I&#39;ve ever had! I highly suggest it!

pTrom3l6gZqI6y-YjVr73w.text: I cant express my frustration enough. I was so excited to eat fine Italian food but now I'll never try it. As soon as our group walked in we were greeted with dirty looks from the manager and older servers. Yes, we were the youngest people in the entire restaurant. I've never been so clearly judged and belittled. We get seated and wait 20 minutes before deciding to leave after watching tables who arrived after us be greeted by a waiter, presented with a wine list and already had orders taken. Do NOT eat here if you are younger than 50 because the entire service staff will assume you don't have enough money to dine there. We came in there with intentions to spend but apparently our 20 something selves were not welcome. As we left, even the server in our section did not bother to ask what was wrong, he just said have a good night. Well, I hope Tomaso's continues to thrive off the retirement community.

ytUUw2iUqT4uPJ14YAbmnA.text: today's 'special' octopus salad was so bad my chickens won't eat it. i'm going to bed with an upset stomach.   it was served cold with a side of "we don't care about your feedback or how crap our food is"  forget this place. the bartender says tomasso is an asshole to work for anyway. as a final point, they've just undergone '5 days of renovations' but didn't wait for the paint fumes to clear. that's probably why the wine tasted so bad.    this place lacks the class it probably used to have

MYmR1iM2UBBlSmqvwD_6rQ.text: Excellent food, excellent service. I had their Petra sole and lobster risotto, and arugula, pear, and pecan salad. Delicious. Classy place.

photos.caption: Photo of Tomaso's - Phoenix, AZ, United States

I0zmMJe8QnhKTPfwSNhfwQ.text: A Phoenix landmark and with good reason. From the moment you walk in the door- you're "home". Want something a little different or maybe off the menu? No problem but the menu is filled with a lifetime full of variety.  Our server, Evan, was on top of everything and extremely friendly and entertaining- ask for him. The food? Well- it's perfect. Try the lasagna and change your life :-)  We even had the great man himself stop over to greet us, poured us a drink of his own creation and welcomed my wife and I to our new favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  It's a classic- believe me. Going back? Of course :-)

Bo8-Ztut_yiwFb0KMf7R-g.text: This place forgot about our table. They ran out of food and picked up frozen broccoli and potatoes to cover it up. 2 hours later we weren't fooled. Merry Christmas!  Side note, overheard cooks talking about a cursed table where tables are frequently forgotten. You are an absolute fool if you ever dine here!!

-d7WWUaHyatpSC8cz5cMIg.text: We came here for a business dinner. Parking was a nightmare, as the lot was very crowded and the line of cars for valet made it hard to actually maneuver around. We ended up parking in a lot around the corner, behind the restaurant, and it was a very short walk to the front entrance.   The interior is cozy, with tasteful decor. Our dinner had some preset options, including a salad, your choice of entree, and dessert. I opted for a prawn dish. The presentation was well done, the prawns were excellently cooked, with a very delicate flavor.   Service was very attentive and drinks were refilled as needed.   Despite the parking hassle, this is a great place for a nice night out and I'll definitely be coming back if I'm in the mood for upscale Italian cuisine.

X15tGzVIwnHXuHR91-FGCw.text: Best Italian in Phoenix! A little bit pricy but totally worth it ! Good service ! The chocolate mousse cake is to die for !

zWEEgwi3oz6uwfiCvqQn6Q.text: Having lived in the Valley for 15 years, we finally made it to Tomaso's, a restaurant I have heard about for years. It was not a special night, just a Saturday date night with my husband. We walked in at 7:30 pm with no reservation. That should have been a sign that we shouldn't eat here.  The food was way over priced, especially for what it was. I had the spaghetti cacio y Pepe and my husband had lemon shrimp. His was delicious, but mine tasted very basic. (Yes, it is an easy dish, but I have had carefully crafted ones at other restaurants and been blown away).   The wine poor was generous. We went with the recommendations of the waiter, but was disappointed when he tried to pass off a stale glass of wine. When I asked him how long the bottle had been open, he made a scene to send over the bartender, tell me it was not stale and pour a new glass 'from the same bottle'... It was a completely different wine they poured us the second time. Tired, I didn't want to make a scene, we accepted it and let it sit on the table.  By the end, we just wanted to leave and our waiter was slow to bring the check. Other tables that he was serving were all eyeing one another as well, looking for sympathy.  It was a sad way to spend $100, I wish we would have gone to North or Hillstone, where the food is always good.

fLVd2x5FiBWdrYqAvB-_7Q.text: Absolutely our favorite Italian restaurant in the valley.  Been here well over 50 times and I can honestly say the food is always outstanding and the service is unmatched. They will accommodate any dish you ask for without the slight hesitation. I enjoy my conversations with Tomaso when I visit.  Superb!

4tFz9d-ai9n8IkecakXHTA.text: Lovely dinner! We all had some variation of seafood that was heavenly. We were in the back room which was nice and we could converse without screaming. Service was a tad slow but it was Saturday nite and very busy. The food was the star with two of us having the halibut,scallop, and risotto special. Nero d'Avola wine was good accompaniment. Finished with the chocolate mousse and cannoli. A Phoenix classic!

LsbhJnVY2Ep7uNooworY8Q.text: From the service to the atmosphere to the food, this restaurant will make you feel like you are eating at a small cafe in Italy.  Just an overall amazing experience.  Food = 5* Atmosphere = 5* Service = 5*

x0_HX6BeSrhbisFTEBdclw.text: My fiance took me here again for a date night surprise. Delicioso! Fresh made pasta and exquisite in taste. He had the filet ravioli and I had the pasta platter with a variety of three different raviolis. Everything was cooked to perfection and service was on point with a smile. I can't wait to come back here again and devour their tasty, creamy, flavorful dishes. Yes.. It's on the pricey side.. But worth every bite. We left with our bellies full and happy. Thank you Tomasos for being an Italian staple to Phoenix!

yNgMZ-Y1McOoeG8dS3_6Sw.text: I love Italian food! This [fancy] place deserves a good review for food and wine and ambiance. I can't argue! I was here for a company's dinner, the wines were excellent. Food was good but not "wow". Perhaps, it's not fair since I didn't pay for dinner. I would like to try this out on a more casual date...and freely rating this place. One thing was cool that the owner had his own wine labeled. Some free sample...then a bottle later between three of us - it was good! Cheers!

G56ptPuJEtt-X0cKrcLFyw.text: What a fantastic place! Food is truly spectacular. Great ambiance, people, setting and service. Veramente ottimo!

LT_xt3L8wSdFDjZlQeWWKQ.text: The Italian Region of Tuscany has given the World one of its greatest cuisines. Whether you consider yourself an aficionado or simply one who loves excellent Italian Food, and you are seeking a very special dining experience, we would like to suggest you treat yourself to an evening at Tomaso's. You will be very glad you did!  Tomaso's on Camelback is beautifully appointed and provides an elegant environment in which to thoroughly enjoy the creations of Chef Tomaso and his Staff. The Restaurant Staff is extremely professional and welcoming, very knowledgeable, and unobtrusively attentive in catering to their guests.    I was a guest of an old friend who had invited me to partner with him in a golf tournament and I wanted to treat him to a special dinner in appreciation. We both happen to share a special affinity for "Pappardelle al Cinghiale" (a Wide Noodle Pasta in a Wild Boar Sauce) that is very difficult to find outside of Tuscany. Just on a whim, I went on Tomaso's Web Site to inquire about the possibility of them making us  "Pappardelle al Cinghiale" one evening - Quite frankly, I didn't expect to even receive an acknowledgement of my inquiry, much less a response and that would be positive - so, what a delightful surprise it was when just a couple of hours later, I received a very warm response from Ms. Rosie Delgado, the Restaurant Manager, saying "Chef Tomaso would be delighted to....!" I was grinning from ear to ear and when I told my friend what was in store for us, he was as every bit as excited as I.  We arrived 15 minutes before our Reservation and when the waiter who greeted our entrance checked the computer, he grinned and said "Ah "Pappardelle al Cinghiale"- my favorite!" and as he led us to our table and seated us, we both were immensely impressed that, not only were we expected but it was known for what we'd come!   Shortly after we were seated and even before we had selected a bottle of Chianti from the extensive Wine List, Chef Tomaso came to greet us and genuinely made us feel special. In addition to the requested Pappardelle, we deferred to Chef Tomaso's recommendations and we were treated to a fabulous meal that consisted of five separate courses -  an Appetizer of molten Mozzarella in a crust of perfectly seasoned bread crumbs, our specially requested  "Pappardelle al Cinghiale" (just like I remembered from Tuscany!), a perfect Lemon Veal Entrata, a delicious Sauvignon Dessert, concluding with a Chocolate Digestivo - each course presented and served elegantly.    Chef Tomaso returned a couple of more times, even sitting with us for a few minutes, checking in on how we were enjoying ourselves and Ms. Delgado did the same. In True European Style, we lingered in very relaxed fashion for over three hours!   Both of us have traveled the world extensively and agreed that nowhere have we experienced a better meal!  In summary.... For Fine Italian Cuisine, an Elegant Environment, Impeccable, Attentive and Accommodating Service, I highly recommend Tomaso's on Camelback.  Buon Appetito!

plNTv8j_L5Mg_hvPLx-5bA.text: The only good thing about this restaurant is their delicious herb infused butter.  Where to start...I absolutely detest restaurants that do not keep online menus current.  We sat and the menu was nothing compared to what was online.  The service was okay...our waiter tried...but honestly we had to crumb our own table etc.  the staff never removed plates or utensils from courses etc.  It was like stepping into a Service Bermuda Triangle.  I saw the older couple next to us was treated normally.  Which is odd...my wife and I do not look poor...at all.  So it's not an age vs wealth discrimination as mentioned in other reviews.  I think they depend on "regulars" who they cater to.  The crowd was geriatric.  We really wanted to leave but the waiter convinced us to stay.  Despite ordering surf and turf with no breading or cheese due to voiced dietary restrictions we were served battered & fried lobster as a substitute.  The lamb osso buco was inedible...which I ordered due to recommendation.  The caprese salad was served sans balsamic vinegar.  Homemade pasta was also really not good.  My wife had to cut her steak with a butter knife because no one brought a steak knife.  On top of that the restaurant was half empty.  I'm sorry this place just has absolutely nothing going for it.  By the looks of the crowd, menu, food and service, this is where people and cuisine go to die.

2X7vUhkUNXvqFuUZQ7V0nA.text: Started out with the bread which was very good. The calamari was good for our appetizer. Main course was chicken parm and seafood / pasta dish. Food was good and service was not good, not near enough staff for the amount of tables, our waiter was very busy the entire time doing his best. This is where I have a value problem, I don't mind the big ticket, but I had better get the whole package and Tomaso's disappointed us.

I6VXm7EJxABErdvinw7kVw.text: NEW location on Scottsdale road is OUTSTANDING and welcomed addition to the area!
